imperturbatus: <entryFree id="n21902" type="main" key="imperturba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imperturbātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-perturbatus</etym>, <sense id="n21902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undisturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unruffled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">imperturbato ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:562" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicis occupationibus quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 73" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 73 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">audio imperturbatus, interritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui constans est, inperturbatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. ib. § 3.</sense></entryFree>
impervius: <entryFree id="n21903" type="main" key="impervi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impervĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpervius</etym>, <sense id="n21903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be passed through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impassable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impervious</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inaccessus, invius): amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">itinera (with interrupta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans><tr>inaccessible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:643" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 643</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis ignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impes: <entryFree id="n21904" type="main" key="impe^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕs</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>; <case>nom.</case> given <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 702</bibl> P., but used only in <sense id="n21904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <itype>pĕtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>in-peto; cf. praepes</etym>, = impetus, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impete vasto amnis fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in juvenes certo sic impete sus fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:359" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 359</bibl></cit>; Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 416</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:903" default="NO" valid="yes">903</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potuit nubes capere inpetis auctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:327 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 327 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:334" default="NO" valid="yes">334</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:591" default="NO" valid="yes">591</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valido impete quatere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 330</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:248" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 248</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti flamina ruunt impetibus crebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 293</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21904.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo tanto membrorum impete, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:913" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 913</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impetibilis: <entryFree id="n21905" type="main" key="impe^ti^bi^lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">impătĭb-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-patibilis</etym>. <sense id="n21905.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insufferable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insupportable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intolerable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem vos, cum improbis poenam proponitis, impetibilem facitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 57</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cruciatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 24</bibl></cit>. § <cit><quote lang="la">59: morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 20, 81, § 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chamaeleon coraci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe atque impetibile est, attonito animo et fronte maesta laetos adire conventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:103" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 103</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21905.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impassible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incapable of suffering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens ex bruto, impetibile de patibili, nunquam potest oriri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 20, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21906" type="main" key="impe^ti^bi^lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>impeto</etym>, <sense id="n21906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">assailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">making an assault</hi> on a person, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, § 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Virgin. 18, § 113</bibl>. <cb n="IMPE" /></sense></entryFree>
impetiginosus: <entryFree id="n21907" type="main" key="impe^ti_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtīgĭnōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>impetigo</etym>, <sense id="n21907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has the impetigo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:6:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 6, § 6</bibl>; cf. impetiginosus <foreign lang="greek">leixhnwto/s,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.— Also: ‡ impetix impetigo, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
impetigo: <entryFree id="n21908" type="main" key="impe^ti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtīgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impeto</etym>, <sense id="n21908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scabby eruption on the skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetigo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 1, 2, § 4</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:31:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 31, 2</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">As a disease of plants,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 223</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impeto: <entryFree id="n21909" type="main" key="impe^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-peto</etym>, <sense id="n21909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rush upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in anteand post-class. prose). </sense><sense id="n21909.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedentem Acheloius heros Impetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:523" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem arcu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os hastā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:273" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 273</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 8</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) impetentes a se eiciunt fucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. in a different orthog.: impite impetum facite, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109, 17</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (a contracted <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>, like cette, ferte): <cit><quote lang="la">impetiti confessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21909.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to accuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem edacitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impetrabilis: <entryFree id="n21910" type="main" key="impe^tra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>impetro</etym>. <sense id="n21910.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy to be obtained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attainable</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. and Cæs.): cui postulanti triumphum rerum gestarum magnitudo impetrabilem faciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia et tuta apud Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 29, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votum facite Junoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 101: <cit><quote lang="la">quo impetrabilior pax esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 16, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21910.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that easily obtains</hi> or <hi rend="ital">effects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">successful</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">non potuit venire orator magis ad me impetrabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetrabilior qui vivat, nullus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nicator Seleucus efficaciae impetrabilis rex, Anim. 14, 8: dies,</quote> <trans><tr>on which a wish is gained</tr>, <tr>favorable</tr>, <tr>propitious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficacia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 8, 21</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a way likely to attain</hi>: impetrabilius, Symm. Or. pro Patr. 4 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
impetratio: <entryFree id="n21911" type="main" key="impe^tra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an obtaining by request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplishment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 58, 2</bibl>; Cod. Th. 11, 22, 4.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istas impetrationes nostras nihil valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impetrativus: <entryFree id="n21912" type="hapax" key="impe^tra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtrātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">obtained by entreaty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">augurium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 190</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impetrator: <entryFree id="n21913" type="main" key="impe^tra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtrātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who obtains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an obtainer</hi> (post-class.): beneficii, Cod. Th. 12, 6, 3.</sense></entryFree>
impetratus: <entryFree id="n21914" type="main" key="impe^tra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an effecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtaining</hi>, Ambros. de Fide, 5, 6, 77.</sense></entryFree>
impetrio: <entryFree id="n21915" type="main" key="impe^tri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtrĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n21915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ītum, 4, <hi rend="ital">v. n. desid.</hi> [id.], relig. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to seek to obtain through omens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to seek by consulting auspices</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nunc extis, sic tunc avibus magnae res impetriri solebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in impetriendis consulendisque rebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui impetrire velit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetritum, inauguratum est: quovis admittunt aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.— <mood>Part.</mood> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impetrītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a favorable auspice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">omen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impetro: <entryFree id="n21916" type="main" key="impe^tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n21916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> impetrarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 40</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf. fut. act.</hi> impetrassere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 23</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-patro</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to pass; to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>, esp. by exertion, request, entreaty (class.; cf.: obtineo, adipiscor, consequor). </sense><sense id="n21916.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., constr. with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21916.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod volui, ut volo, impetravi per amicitiam et gratiam a Philocomasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc confido a fratre me impetrassere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a me istam exceptionem numquam impetrabunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei Dolabella rogatu meo civitatem a Caesare impetravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decet abs te id impetrarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni re considerandum est et quid postules ab amico et quid patiare a te impetrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum id impetrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum istuc, quod postulo, impetro cum gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti ea, quae vellent, impetrarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(chorus) Impetrat et pacem et locupletem frugibus annum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restitutionem patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:4" default="NO">11, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: post impetratam studiis meis <pb n="903" /> <cb n="IMPE" /> quietem, id. Prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: impetrato Fortis Augusti reditu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21916.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.: Cl.</hi> Quid, si ego impetro atque exoro a vilico, causa mea Ut eam illi permittat? <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Quid si ego ab armigero impetro, Eam illi permittat? atque hoc, credo, impetrassere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:51 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 51 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetrabis igitur a Caesare, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, A, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 7:26" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 7, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Sequanis impetrat, ut per fines suos ire Helvetios patiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbisne istis, ut pugnent, te impetraturum credis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 46, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo impetravi, ut ne quid ei succenseat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadeo, a te impetres, ne sis nugax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem impetravi abiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 190</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: aegre ab iis impetratum est summa tribunorum plebis contentione, ut in senatu recitarentur (litterae); <cit><quote lang="la">ut vero ex litteris ad senatum referretur, impetrari non potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 59, § 136</bibl>.—In <case>abl.</case> of the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetrato, ut manerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 30, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21916.4" n="(g)" level="5"> * With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippina in oppidum Ubiorum veteranos coloniamque deduci impetrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21916.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipere multo est quam impetrare facilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilarus exit, impetravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 131</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Jus hic orat. <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Impetrabit te advocato atque arbitro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid attinet dicere, si contendisset, impetraturum non fuisse, cum, etc.?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id ita fecisset ... si non impetraret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab proximis impetrare non possent, ulteriores tentant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul, ut, si quid possent, de induciis fallendo impetrarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sperare, ab eo de sua ac militum salute impetrare posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 36, 3</bibl></cit>; Hirt. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 6, 2</bibl>.—Esp.: impetras, <hi rend="ital">you have your request</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I will do as you desire</hi>, nolo ames. <hi rend="ital">Pae.</hi> Facile impetras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 63</bibl>: adpropera! age, amabo! <hi rend="ital">Mu.</hi> Impetras, abeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 39</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21916.6" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n21916.7" n="A" level="2"> Like impetrio: <cit><quote lang="la">exstat annalium memoria, sacris quibusdam et precationibus vel cogi fulmina vel impetrari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 53, 54, § 140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21916.8" n="B" level="2"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">to obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get possession of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut superior sis mihi quam quisquam qui impetrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impetulans: <entryFree id="n21917" type="hapax" key="impe^tu^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtŭlans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inpetulans</etym>, <sense id="n21917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very petulant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proruptio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> dub. (al. petulans).</sense></entryFree>
impetuosus: <entryFree id="n21918" type="main" key="impe^tu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>impetus</etym>, <sense id="n21918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, Epit. Iliad. 919.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtŭōsē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuously</hi>: contendit ad moenia, Auct. de Prog. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 5</bibl>: Acron ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impetus: <entryFree id="n21919" type="main" key="impe^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĕtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype> (<case>dat.</case> impetu, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 3</bibl>; no <sense id="n21919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.; abl.</hi> impetibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 293</bibl>; v. also impes), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>impeto</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onset</hi> (freq. and class.; in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number> equally common). </sense><sense id="n21919.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21919.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">incursio atque impetus armatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiis destrictis in eos impetum fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum facere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 46</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:18:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 18, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare impetum in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 28, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 19, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere impetum in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes impetu facto celeriter nostros perturbaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum magno impetu oppugnare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo hostium impetu pulsi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus gladiorum excipere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 52, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum sustinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre impetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fracto impetu levissimi hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum propulsare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec primum quidem impetum, nec secundum, nec tertium, sustinere potuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 36, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno impetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 26, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum domare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 31, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tantum (cupiditates) in alios caeco impetu incurrunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 44</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: biformato impetu Centaurus, <hi rend="ital">with double - shaped attack</hi>, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; v. biformatus.—</sense><sense id="n21919.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21919.4" n="1" level="3"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">an attack</hi> of a disease, <hi rend="ital">a fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paroxysm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pituitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeliacorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 14, 53, § 148</bibl></cit>: oculorum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">inflammation</hi>, <cb n="IMPI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">thymum e vino tumores et impetus tollit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 21, 89, § 157</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 58, § 122</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n21919.5" n="2" level="3"> In mechanics, <hi rend="ital">the pressure</hi> of a load, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21919.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. (without reference to an object), <hi rend="ital">violent impulse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rapid motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuosity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21919.7" n="A" level="2"> Physical: labitur uncta carina, volat super impetus undas, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 379 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">in magno impetu maris atque aperto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hebri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus caeli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rapid motion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 200</bibl>. — Hence also <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: quieti corpus nocturno impetu Dedi, <hi rend="ital">in the nocturnal revolution</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in the night</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus ipse animaï Et fera vis venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 591</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantos impetus ventorum sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21919.8" n="B" level="2"> Mental, <hi rend="ital">impulse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passion</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n21919.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repentino quodam impetu animi incitatus,</quote> <trans><tr>internal pressure</tr>, <tr>impulse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tota mente omnique animi impetu in rem publicam incumbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetu magis quam consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter in oratione nec impetus ullus nec vis esse potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:229" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 229</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnem impetum dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones quae recitantur impetum omnem caloremque perdunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resumere impetum fractum omissumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens impetus ad bella maximi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 55, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est prudentis, sustinere ut currum sic impetum benevolentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinus impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 49, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex hoc impetu rerum nihil prolatando remittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec impetus famae et favor exercitus languesceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est mihi per saevas impetus ire feras,</quote> <trans><tr>I feel an impulse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bessus occidendi protinus regis impetum ceperat,</quote> <trans><tr>had formed a sudden purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim moriendi impetum cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: Da spatium tenuemque moram, male cuncta ministrat impetus,</quote> <trans><tr>haste makes waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:704 sq" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 704 sq.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n21919.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia, quae habent suos impetus et rerum appetitus,</quote> <trans><tr>impulses</tr>, <tr>instincts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an fortitudo, nisi insanire coeperit, impetus suos non habebit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperantia est rationis in libidinem atque in alios non rectos impetus animi firma et moderata dominatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanos atque indomitos impetus vulgi cohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impexus: <entryFree id="n21920" type="main" key="impexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impexus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpexus</etym>, <sense id="n21920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncombed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n21920.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stiriaque impexis induruit horrida barbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput impexa foedum porrigine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tisiphoneque impexa feros pro crinibus angues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:69" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegumen immane leonis Terribili impexum seta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 666</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n21920.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, = incultus, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitas tristis et impexa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impiamentum: <entryFree id="n21921" type="main" key="impi^a_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>impio</etym>, <sense id="n21921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contamination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defilement</hi> (lat. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">altaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impico: <entryFree id="n21922" type="main" key="impi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-pico</etym>, <sense id="n21922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover with pitch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoram diligenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pediculos uvarum dura pice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 43, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impie: <entryFree id="n21923" type="main" key="impi^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impius <sense id="n21923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impietas: <entryFree id="n21924" type="main" key="impi^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭĕtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impius</etym>, <sense id="n21924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of reverence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungodliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undutifulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disloyalty</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est quod tam miseros faciat quam impietas et scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 4</bibl>: impietatis duces, <hi rend="ital">of disloyalty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treason to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impietatem punire voluit (legum lator),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>undutifulness to parents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; Suet. Vit. Luc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 477</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albucilla defertur impietatis in principem,</quote> <trans><tr>of high-treason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:33:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 33, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impigens: <entryFree id="n21925" type="main" key="impi^gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-piget</etym>, <sense id="n21925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwearied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unremitting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">levandi voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:11:102" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 11, 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impiger: <entryFree id="n21926" type="main" key="impi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭger</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>gra, grum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpiger</etym>, <sense id="n21926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not indolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwearied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indefatigable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">energetic</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laboriosus, navus, industrius): se praebebat patientem atque impigrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scribendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir ad labores belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: ceciditque<cb n="IMPI" />  in strage suorum, Impiger ad letum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 798</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impiger manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 16, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impiger, iracundus, inexorabilis, acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:883" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 883</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurtha ut erat impigro atque acri ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impigrae mentis experientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1452</bibl></cit>: impigrae linguae, ignavi animi, Sall. Or. Licin. ad Pleb. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.— With a partitive <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impiger fluminum Rhodanus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the swiftest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— With a respective <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quirinus impiger militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 48</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impiger hostium vexare turmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 240</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭgrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">actively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">readily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de nocte multa impigreque exsurrexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius impigre prudenterque suorum et hostium res pariter attendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 88, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impigre se movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem impigre milites secuti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impigre promissum auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> in the <pos>adj.</pos> and <pos>adv.</pos> seem not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
impigre: <entryFree id="n21927" type="main" key="impi^gre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭgrē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impiger <sense id="n21927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impigritas: <entryFree id="n21928" type="hapax" key="impi_^gri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impī^grĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impiger</etym>, <sense id="n21928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">activity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indefatigableness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri fortissimi fortitudinis, impigritatis, patientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:28:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 28, 40</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 125, 22</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
impigritia: <entryFree id="n21929" type="main" key="impi_^gri^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impī^grĭtĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">activity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indefatigableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persistency</hi>, Ambros. de Noë, 2, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Jacob. 2, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impigritas pro impigritia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 125, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impilia: <entryFree id="n21930" type="main" key="impi^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭlĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>in-pĭlus</etym>, <sense id="n21930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">felt shoes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 10, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impingo: <entryFree id="n21931" type="main" key="impingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impingo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>pēgi, pactum, 3</itype> (archaic <sense id="n21931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> impingier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 76</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-pango</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to push</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">drive at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to thrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dash against</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; cf.: incutio, infligo, illido). </sense><sense id="n21931.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnum in os impinge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustriculam in dentes, Afran. ap. Fest. s. v. mustricula, p. 148 Müll.: a paucioribus Othonianis quo minus in vallum impingerentur,</quote> <trans><tr>would have been driven to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impactus in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:3:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <hi rend="ital">to forge on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubete huic crassas compedes impingier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 24</bibl>; cf.: fustem alicui, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem Aesopo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueum alicui, Sen. Tranq. an. 10: caput parieti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes arbori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 3, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor scopulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:187" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 805</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:28" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impinge pugnum, si muttiverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pessimus gubernator, qui navem, dum portum egreditur, impegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clitellas ferus impingas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes vehementer impactae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: impingere se in columnas, <hi rend="ital">to dash one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self against</hi>, id. de Ira, 1, 19, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">cum caede magna (hostem) in aciem altiore superstantem tumulo inpegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18, 14</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: calcem impingere alicui rei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to give it a kick</tr>, <tr>to cast it aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46</bibl></cit>; v. calx. — </sense><sense id="n21931.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force upon</hi> one (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">huic calix mulsi impingendus est, ut plorare desinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum libidinose,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast upon</tr>, <tr>direct to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21931.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">push</hi> or <hi rend="ital">force to</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">illum libido in contraria impinget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in litem ac molestiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 117</bibl></cit>: dicam tibi impingam grandem, <hi rend="ital">I will direct</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring against you</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae munus suum,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw in her face</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestas Catilinam patriae suae impegit,</quote> <trans><tr>drove</tr>, <tr>incited him against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:12:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod populos scelerata impegit in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: quocumque visum est, libido se impingit, id. de Ira, 2, 8.</sense></entryFree>
impinguo: <entryFree id="n21932" type="main" key="impinguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impinguo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), no <sense id="n21932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>in-pinguis</etym>. </sense><sense id="n21932.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make fat</hi> (post-class.): impinguo <foreign lang="greek">piai/nw,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui cor impinguatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n21932.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become fat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcellum tamdiu coques, donec lenis fiat et impinguet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7:section=375" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7, § 375</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impio: <entryFree id="n21933" type="main" key="impi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>impius</etym>, <sense id="n21933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render impious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sinful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defile with sin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pollute</hi> (ante- and postclass.): si erga parentem aut deos me impiavi,<pb n="904" /> <cb n="IMPL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impias, ere, te! oratorem verberas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor coinquinatum vitiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hymn. Ant. Somn. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruore humano aspersus atque impiatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 110</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reus tot caedibus impiatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>, p. 131: <cit><quote lang="la">thalamos tanto facinore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1185" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Th. 43</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: toties Romanis impiatum est, quoties triumphatum, Minuc. Fel. Oct. 25.</sense></entryFree>
impite: <entryFree id="n21934" type="main" key="impi^te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭte</orth>, v. impeto.</entryFree>
impius: <entryFree id="n21935" type="main" key="impi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-pius</etym>, <sense id="n21935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without reverence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">respect</hi> for God, one's parents, or one's country; <hi rend="ital">irreverent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungodly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undutiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpatriotic; abandoned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wicked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impious</hi> (rare but class.; cf.: nefarius, sacrilegus). </sense><sense id="n21935.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">me fugerat, deorum immortalium has esse in impios et consceleratos poenas certissimas constitutas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numero impiorum et sceleratorum haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerosus atque impius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(deos) piorum et impiorum habere rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impius ne audeto placare donis iram deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixerunt impium pro parricida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:52" default="NO">7, 1, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impius erga parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impium, qui dividere nolit cum fratre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est, iste, qui affinem fortunis spoliare conatus est, impium se esse fateatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Danaides) Impiae sponsos potuere duro Perdere ferro!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titanes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors Gigantum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <trans><tr>invoked in imprecations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>accursed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expiari impium non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 30</bibl></cit> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impiissimus filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:46:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 46, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 17</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21935.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. or abstr. things (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">si impias propinquorum manus effugeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora Thracum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 10, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 802</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum injustum atque impium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:52" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivacitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">3. — Prov.: Impia sub dulci melle venena latent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 104</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21935.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">impii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">wicked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandoned men</hi> (opp. innoxii), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21935.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">impĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">profane words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impious sayings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impia et illicita dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 17</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n21935.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., impia herba, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perh. the <hi rend="ital">French everlasting</hi>, Gnaphalium Gallicum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 113, § 173</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">im-pĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">irreligiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undutifully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wickedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (astra) qui videat, non solum indocte, sed etiam impie faciat, si deos esse neget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impie commissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impie ingratus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>treasonably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserere regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impiissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> de Avar. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
implacabilis: <entryFree id="n21936" type="main" key="impla_ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implācābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inplacabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unappeasable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implacable</hi> (rare but class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in aliquem</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seque mihi implacabilem inexpiabilemque praeberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implacabilis esse alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 35, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem implacabilis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 29, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grave et implacabile numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuro Stygii caput implacabile fontis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 816</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:253" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteri odio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16, 12</bibl></cit>; Ael. <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Vit. Sev. 18</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">implācābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">implacably</hi>, only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui implacabilius irascebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
implacabilitas: <entryFree id="n21937" type="main" key="impla_ca_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implācābĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>implacabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">implacability</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
implacabilius: <entryFree id="n21938" type="main" key="impla_ca_bi^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implācābĭlĭus</orth>, <sense id="n21938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp. adv.</hi>, v. implacabilis <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
implacatus: <entryFree id="n21939" type="main" key="impla_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implācātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-placatus</etym>, <sense id="n21939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unappeased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsatisfied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unallayed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Charybdis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:847" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 847</bibl></cit>. <cb n="IMPL" /></sense></entryFree>
implacidus: <entryFree id="n21940" type="main" key="impla^ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implăcĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-placidus</etym>, <sense id="n21940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ungentle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Genauni, implacidum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars divum implacidissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implacido letalis Sirius igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:216" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:199" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 199</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
implago: <entryFree id="n21941" type="hapax" key="impla^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implăgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-plaga</etym>, <sense id="n21941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring into a net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to entangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensnare.</hi> —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in retia sua praecipites implagabuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
implano: <entryFree id="n21942" type="main" key="impla_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implāno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. in-plano = impedio, hence trop. = decipio</etym>, <sense id="n21942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delude</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 15, 12 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
implanus: <entryFree id="n21943" type="main" key="impla_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inplanus</etym>, <sense id="n21943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uneven</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">inter implana urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 27:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 27, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
implebilis: <entryFree id="n21944" type="main" key="imple_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implēbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>impleo</etym>, <sense id="n21944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filling up</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vomitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:139" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 139</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
implecticus: <entryFree id="n21945" type="hapax" key="implecti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implectĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-plecto</etym>, <sense id="n21945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that turns about with difficulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immovable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 29</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
implecto: <entryFree id="n21946" type="main" key="implecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implecto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-plecto</etym>, <sense id="n21946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">twist into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twist among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to interweave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interlace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entwine</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose;
