usually in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n21946.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae hirudines dentibus (crocodili) implectuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inplexis ita principiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dracones quaternos quinosque inter se cratium modo implexos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 13, 13, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus horrore implexus atque impeditus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 276</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a Greek construction, caeruleos implexae crinibus angues Eumenides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus implexis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n21946.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidua implexa luctu continuo,</quote> <trans><tr>implicated</tr>, <tr>involved</tr>, <tr>entangled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 10</bibl></cit>, v. Orell. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
implementum: <entryFree id="n21947" type="main" key="imple_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implēmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>impleo</etym>, <sense id="n21947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a filling up</hi>, as a diseased condition: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a determination of blood to the head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:148" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impleo: <entryFree id="n21948" type="main" key="imple^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>ēvi, ētum, 2</itype> (sync. forms: <sense id="n21948.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">implerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 461</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:99" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:666 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 666 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:59" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:280 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 280 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implessem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 667</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inplesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:78 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 78 al.</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inpleo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to fill up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. expleo, compleo). </sense><sense id="n21948.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21948.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n21948.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>) <hi rend="ital">aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is vomens frustis esculentis gremium suum et totum tribunal implevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implevitque mero pateram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foros flammis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbarum suco expresso caput impleatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>be wet all over with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caput calido oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibis vinoque venas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: manum pinu flagranti, <hi rend="ital">fills his hand with</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">grasps</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusti istorum caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the comic pun: quae (dolia) nisi erunt semper plena, ego te implebo flagris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis oraculis Chrysippus totum volumen implevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 115</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptunus ventis implevit vela secundis,</quote> <trans><tr>filled</tr>, <tr>swelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21948.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid alicujus rei</hi> (in analogy with plenus; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">compleo): ollam denariorum implere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21948.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With a simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id mustum coicies in amphoram et implebis ad summum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter de ipsa justitia quatuor implevit sane grandes libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 87</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21948.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21948.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fill</hi> with food, <hi rend="ital">to satisfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeparatā nos implevimus cenā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implentur veteris Bacchi pinguisque ferinae,</quote> <trans><tr>satisfy</tr>, <tr>regale themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 215</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vis impleri, mid.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:75" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se interdiu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21948.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make fleshy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aqua inter cutem quem implevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implet corpus modica exercitatio, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>makes fat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascentes implent conchylia lunae,</quote> <trans><tr>fill up</tr>, <tr>fatten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nomentanae vites se frequenter implent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence also of women and animals, <hi rend="ital">to make pregnant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impregnate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Peleus Thetidem) ingenti implet Achille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 265</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 698</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 111</bibl>; 9, 280; so of animals: sues implentur uno <cb n="IMPL" /> coitu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:76" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 23, 39, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n21948.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fill up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amount to</hi> a certain measure: <cit><quote lang="la">mensuraque roboris ulnas Quinque ter implebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 748</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboris crassitudo quatuor hominum ulnas complectentium implebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 202</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 10, 20, § 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna quater junctis implerat cornibus orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 344</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 530</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n21948.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21948.11" n="A" level="2"> Ingen., <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make full.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21948.12" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>) <hi rend="ital">aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impune ut urbem nomine impleris meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:59" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem tumultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voce deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:167" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem hortatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus falsis terroribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulos lacrimosis vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem exspectatione vana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 29, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites praeda,</quote> <trans><tr>satisfy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 20, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia terrore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anxiis curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 56, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vacua causarum conviciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:114" default="NO">4, 2, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem alioqui levem sententiarum pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sese sociorum, cum regum sanguine implerint,</quote> <trans><tr>have filled</tr>, <tr>covered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se caedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:528" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ager vitibus implet,</quote> <trans><tr>enriches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 56</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia delubra pacem deum exposcentium virorum turba inplebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>were thronged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21948.13" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>) <hi rend="ital">alicujus rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriter adulescentem suae temeritatis implet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia erroris mutui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 41, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem spei animorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes fugae et formidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 14, 20</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n21948.14" n="(g)" level="5"> With the simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta magni Herculis implerant terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 667</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tectum magnus hospes impleveris,</quote> <trans><tr>hast filled with thy presence</tr>, <tr>thy greatness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:15:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non semper implet (Demosthenes) aures meas,</quote> <trans><tr>does not always satisfy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium novercae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 135</bibl></cit>: implere ceterorum rudes animos, i. q. <hi rend="ital">to inflame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to poison</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs deinde impletur (sc. contagione morbi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum implevere medullas maturae mala nequitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:215" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to follow after</tr>, <tr>imitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceras pusillas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cover with writing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:30" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ceras capaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 432</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21948.15" n="(d)" level="5"> With the simple <case>abl.</case>: Minyae clamoribus implent (sc. Jasonem), <hi rend="ital">fill</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">spur on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame by acclamation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21948.16" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21948.17" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fill up</hi> a portion of time or a number, <hi rend="ital">to make out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer, qui nondum impleverat annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octavum et nonagesimum annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me quater undenos sciat implevisse Decembres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 16, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem vitae sponte an fato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impleta ut essent sex milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes conscripserat ac triginta legionum instar impleverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:20:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si numerum, si tres implevero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21948.18" n="2" level="3"> With the accessory notion of activity, <hi rend="ital">to fulfil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">content</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne id profiteri videar, quod non possim implere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 18, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">promissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munia sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incohatas delationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam quam spem ille de me concepit, partes officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 56, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 52, 2</bibl> (D): <cit><quote lang="la">impleverim!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desideria naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequiarum officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionis officium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 2, 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis officium, Lact. Op. Dei, 20, 9: officium (opp. suscipere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:161" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 13, 8</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with a personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">implere censorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to discharge the office of censor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:95" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 95 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n21948.19" n="3" level="3"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to make emphatic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make prominent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirma, nisi majore quodam oratoris spiritu implentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impletio: <entryFree id="n21949" type="main" key="imple_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implētĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impleo</etym>, <sense id="n21949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ful filment</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. 2, 2, p. 52</bibl> Rittersh.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 11, 40, 3</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
impletus: <entryFree id="n21950" type="main" key="imple_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implētus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from impleo.</entryFree>
implexio: <entryFree id="n21951" type="main" key="implexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implexĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>implecto</etym>, <pb n="905" /> <cb n="IMPL" /> <sense id="n21951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an entwining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entangling</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">serpentis gemini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
implexus: <entryFree id="n21952" type="main" key="implexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implexus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from implecto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21953" type="main" key="implexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>implecto</etym>, <sense id="n21953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an entwining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infolding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi> (post-Aug. and only in the <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">polypus cavernam cancellato bracchiorum implexu claudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut terra et aqua mutuo implexu jungerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 65, 66, § 166</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
implicamentum: <entryFree id="n21954" type="main" key="impli^ca_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implĭcāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inplico</etym>, <sense id="n21954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an involvement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entanglement</hi> (late Lat.).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseriarum implicamentis se expedire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Serm. Dom. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Serm. Dom. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
implicatio: <entryFree id="n21955" type="main" key="impli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implĭcātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an entwining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interweaving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entanglement</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">nervorum implicatio toto corpore pertinens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oportebit per locorum communium implicationem demonstrare, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>an interweaving</tr>, <tr>intermixing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:32:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 32, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter implicationem rei familiaris,</quote> <trans><tr>involvement</tr>, <tr>embarrassment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:46:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 46, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
implicatrix: <entryFree id="n21956" type="gloss" key="impli^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implĭcātrix</orth> <foreign lang="greek">e)mplektri/a,</foreign> Gloss. Phil.</entryFree>
implicatura: <entryFree id="n21957" type="main" key="impli^ca_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implĭcātūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>implico</etym>, <sense id="n21957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an entangling</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vernaculae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
implicatus: <entryFree id="n21958" type="main" key="impli^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implĭcātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from implico.</entryFree>
impliciscor: <entryFree id="n21959" type="main" key="impli^ciscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implĭciscor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>sci</itype>, <sense id="n21959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. inch. n.</hi> [implico], <hi rend="ital">to become confused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disordered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum tibi sensisti, mulier, impliciscier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 97</bibl></cit>. — In the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form: ne quid tibi ex frigore impliciscat, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad M. Caes. 3:13" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad M. Caes. 3, 13</bibl>; cf.: implicisco <foreign lang="greek">a)potropia/zw,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
implicite: <entryFree id="n21960" type="main" key="impli^ci^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implĭcĭtē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. implico, <sense id="n21960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
implicito: <entryFree id="n21961" type="hapax" key="impli^ci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implĭcĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>implico</etym>, <sense id="n21961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to entwine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interweave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphinus exsilit, mergitur, variosque orbes implicitat expeditque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 33, 5</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. implicat).</sense></entryFree>
implicitus: <entryFree id="n21962" type="main" key="impli^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implĭcĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from implico.</entryFree>
implico: <entryFree id="n21963" type="main" key="impli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, or</itype> (twice in Cic., and freq. since the Aug. per.) ŭi, ĭtum (v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 550 sq.), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-plico, to fold into; hence</etym>, <sense id="n21963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to infold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">involve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entwine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inwrap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grasp</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: irretio, impedio). </sense><sense id="n21963.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">involvulus in pampini folio se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tenax hedera huc et illuc Arborem implicat errans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:ib. 107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 107</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">et nunc huc inde huc incertos implicat orbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrae se parvus Iulus Implicuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 724</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">implicuit materno bracchia collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicuitque suos circum mea colla lacertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicuitque comam laevā,</quote> <trans><tr>grasped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 552</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sertis comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondenti tempora ramo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 136</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:220" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 220</bibl>: in parte inferiore hic implicabatur caput, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 123, 16</bibl> (implicare positum pro ornare, Non.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquila implicuit pedes atque unguibus haesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effusumque equitem super ipse (equus) secutus Implicat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 894</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congressi in proelia totas Implicuere inter se acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicare ac perturbare aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lues) ossibus implicat ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 355</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quini erant ordines conjuncti inter se atque implicati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canidia brevibus implicata viperis Crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium implicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 65, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestinum implicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 4, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impliciti laqueis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerberos implicitis angue minante comis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicitamque sinu absstulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impliciti Peleus rapit oscula nati,</quote> <trans><tr>held in his arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:264" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 264</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n21963.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21963.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to entangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">involve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di immortales vim suam ... tum terrae cavernis includunt, tum hominum naturis implicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahendis negotiis implicari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienis (rebus) nimis implicari molestum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicari aliquo certo genere cursuque vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicari negotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse te impedies, ipse tua defensione implicabere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: multis implicari erroribus, <cb n="IMPL" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:27:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 27, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum primo incertis implicantes responsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte implacabiles irae vestrae implicaverint animos vestros,</quote> <trans><tr>perplexed</tr>, <tr>confounded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 46, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucitas in partitione servatur, si genera ipsa rerum ponuntur, neque permixte cum partibus implicantur,</quote> <trans><tr>are mingled</tr>, <tr>mixed up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:22:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 22, 32</bibl></cit>: ut omnibus copiis conductis te implicet, ne ad me iter tibi expeditum sit, Pompei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, D, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti errores implicant temporum, ut nec qui consules nec quid quoque anno actum sit digerere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum rei publicae quaedam procuratio multis officiis implicatum et constrictum tenebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus nullis occupationibus est implicatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">implicatus molestis negotiis et operosis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos dederit suis angoribus et molestiis implicatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippina morbo corporis implicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconstantia tua cum levitate, tum etiam perjurio implicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervalla, quibus implicata atque permixta oratio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 56, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(voluptas) penitus in omni sensu implicata insidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quatuor inter se colligata atque implicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura non tam propensus ad misericordiam quam implicatus ad severitatem videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 85</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the form implicitus, esp. with morbo (in morbum): quies necessaria morbo implicitum exercitum tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 40, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi se quisque videbat Implicitum morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviore morbo implicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">implicitus in morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 34, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicitus suspicionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">implicitus terrore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litibus implicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicitam sinu abstulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vinum) jam sanos implicitos facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8:87" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21963.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to attach closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connect intimately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be intimately connected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">associated</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">related</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(homo) profectus a caritate domesticorum ac suorum serpat longius et se implicet primum civium, deinde mortalium omnium societate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes qui nostris familiaritatibus implicantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:27:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 27, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(L. Gellius) ita diu vixit, ut multarum aetatum oratoribus implicaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:174" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 47, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus applicari expediet, non implicari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 105:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 105, 5</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos habere implicatos consuetudine et benevolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicatus amicitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicati ultro et citro vel usu diuturno vel etiam officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 85</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n21963.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">implĭcātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">entangled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intricate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in Torquati sermone quicquam implicatum aut tortuosum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquae (partes orationis) sunt magnae, implicatae, variae, graves, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 52</bibl></cit>: vox rauca et implicata, Sen. Apocol. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicatior ad loquendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6, 18</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurissima et implicatissima quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista tortuosissima et implicatissima nodositas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21963.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">im-plĭcĭtē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">intricately</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">non implicite et abscondite, sed patentius et expeditius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
implorabilis: <entryFree id="n21964" type="hapax" key="implo_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implōrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>imploro</etym>, <sense id="n21964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be prayed to for help</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen nautis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:572" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 572</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imploratio: <entryFree id="n21965" type="main" key="implo_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implōrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beseeching for help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imploring</hi> (rare but good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">omnium deorum et hominum et civium et sociorum imploratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad invidiosam implorationem converti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imploro: <entryFree id="n21966" type="main" key="implo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implōro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic form: endoplorato implorato, quod est cum questione inclamare: implorare namque est cum fletu rogare, quod est proprie vapulantis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=77" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 77</bibl> Müll.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-ploro</etym>, <sense id="n21966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to invoke with tears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call upon for aid; to invoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beseech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implore</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. invoco). </sense><sense id="n21966.1" n="I" level="1"> With personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">quem enim alium appellem? quem obtester? quem implorem?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: vos etiam atque etiam imploro et appello, sanctissimae<cb n="IMPL" />  deae ... deos deasque omnes imploro atque obtestor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos precari, venerari, implorare debetis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 13, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen filii, i. e. filium nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres milites passis crinibus flentes implorabant, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imploratus a Siculis in auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cujus auxilium Hamilcar imploratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Veiis exercitum Camillumque ducem implorabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—With two <case>acc.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Romanos imploratos auxilium adversus Philippum tulisse opem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21966.2" n="II" level="1"> With inanim. or abstr. objects, <hi rend="ital">to pray earnestly for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beseech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appeal to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui deus appellandus est? cujus hominis fides imploranda est?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 94 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 40, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestram fidem, dignitatem, religionem in judicando non imploro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62, § 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus vestros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heracliti memoriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implorantes jura libertatis et civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater filii nomen implorans,</quote> <trans><tr>repeating aloud with tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 49</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">129: auxilium a populo Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nequicquam ejus auxilium, si postea velit, senatum imploraturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium prope eversae urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (altera pars) non oratoris ingenium, sed consulis auxilium implorat et flagitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius opem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">poscit opem chorus et ... Caelestes implorat aquas docta prece blandus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 12</bibl></cit>.— Rarely <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mederis erroribus, sed implorantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:46:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 46, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
implumbo: <entryFree id="n21967" type="hapax" key="implumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implumbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inplumbo</etym>, <sense id="n21967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to solder in with lead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreos cnodaces in capitibus scaporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
implumis: <entryFree id="n21968" type="main" key="implu_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implūmis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-pluma</etym>, <sense id="n21968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without feathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfledged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">callow.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21968.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">assidens implumibus pullis avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus columbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 64, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coni (galearum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:421" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 421</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 716</bibl>. — * </sense><sense id="n21968.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">without hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bald</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud in utero pilis vestitum, aliud inplume,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 219</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impluo: <entryFree id="n21969" type="main" key="implu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n21969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [in-pluo]. </sense><sense id="n21969.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rain into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rain</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">deorsum, quo impluebat, impluvium dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=161" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 161</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">fanum Veneris, in cujus quandam aream non impluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 96, 97, § 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus immane turgescit, ita ut arborum comis, quae margini insistunt, superjectae asperginis fragor impluat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam impluerit, ab avibus aut formicis sata non infestari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si arcus circa occasum refulsit, rorabit et leviter impluet,</quote> <trans><tr>will rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penēus ... summis aspergine silvis Impluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 573</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21969.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum quom impluit ceteris, ne impluat mi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21969.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rain upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impluviatus color, quasi fumato stillicidio implutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 548, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
implutus: <entryFree id="n21970" type="main" key="implu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from impluo.</entryFree>
impluviatus: <entryFree id="n21971" type="main" key="implu^vi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implŭvĭātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>impluvium</etym>, <sense id="n21971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shaped like an</hi> impluvium, i. e. <hi rend="ital">four-sided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having a square border</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of garment worn by women</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impluvium: <entryFree id="n21972" type="main" key="implu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">implŭvĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpl-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>impluo</etym>. <sense id="n21972.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a skylight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the opening in the roof of the atrium in a Roman house through which the smoke issued</hi>, so called because it admitted the rain (cf. compluvium): <cit><quote lang="la">per inpluvium intro spectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quis inspectavit per nostrum inpluvium intus apud nos Philocomasium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> v. 19: <cit><quote lang="la">per inpluvium huc despexi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alienas tegulas venisse clanculum per inpluvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis per inpluvium decidit de tegulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">utin' inpluvium erat induta?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula per impluvium in tegulas subduci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21972.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21972.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The square basin in the atrium into which the rain-water was received</hi>: si relictum erat in medio ut lucem caperet, deorsum quo impluebat dictum impluvium, susum <pb n="906" /> <cb n="IMPO" /> qua compluebat, compluvium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=161" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 161</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=108" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 108</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">rus signa, quae nunc ad impluvium tuum stant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:23:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 23, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae ad impluvium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 56</bibl></cit>, § 147.— </sense><sense id="n21972.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The uncovered central space in the atrium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmam enatam in inpluvio suo T. Marcus Figulus nuntiabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 13, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impoene: <entryFree id="n21973" type="main" key="impoene"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impoene</orth>, v. impune, II.</entryFree>
impoenitens: <entryFree id="n21974" type="main" key="impoeni^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impoenĭtens</orth>, etc., v. impaenitens, etc.</entryFree>
impolite: <entryFree id="n21975" type="main" key="impo^li_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏlītē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impolitus <sense id="n21975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impolitia: <entryFree id="n21976" type="main" key="impo^li_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏlītĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impolitus</etym>, <sense id="n21976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of neatness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis eques Romanus equum habere gracilentum aut parum nitidum visus erat, impolitiae notabatur: id verbum significat, quasi si tu dicas incuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: impolitias censores facere dicebantur, cum equiti aes abnegabant ob equum male curatum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=108" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 108</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
impolitus: <entryFree id="n21977" type="main" key="impo^li_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏlītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-politus</etym>, <sense id="n21977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21977.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">structurae lapidum impolitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8,63</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n21977.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrefined</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">orationes Catonis valde laudo, significant enim quandam formam ingenii, sed admodum impolitam et plane rudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:294" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 85, 294</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hebes atque impolitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:31:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 31, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Timaeus ipsa compositione verborum non impolitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammaticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impolitae vero res et acerbae si erunt relictae, efferent se aliquando, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unfinished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 34</bibl></cit>. — * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏlītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without ornament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi breviter impoliteque dicenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 214</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impollutus: <entryFree id="n21978" type="main" key="impollu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impollūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpollutus</etym>, <sense id="n21978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unstained, unpolluted</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:679" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intemeratus, impollutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impomenta: <entryFree id="n21979" type="gloss" key="impo_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impōmenta</orth> <itype>quasi imponimenta, quae post cenam mensis imponebant</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=108:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 108, 18</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
impono: <entryFree id="n21980" type="main" key="impo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype> (arch. forms of the <sense id="n21980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> imposivit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imposisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; sync. form of the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> impostus, a, um, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 543</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 716</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:186" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:2:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:227 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 227 al.</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-pono</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lay into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> a place (very freq. and class.); constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">aliquid in aliquam rem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alicui rei;</hi> rarely <hi rend="ital">in aliqua re</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21980.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21980.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: pedem in undam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc in collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in rogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in ignem imposita'st: fletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem aciem suam redis et carris circumdederunt: eo mulieres imposuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites eo (i. e. in equos),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in foco Lari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam auream litteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 31, 76</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">collegae diadema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operi incohato fastigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondera nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serta delubris et farra cultris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:84" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clitellas bovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes rogis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 477</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:473" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 473</bibl></cit>: natum axi (i. e. in currum). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:321" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 321</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontibus ancillarum vittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:118" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ali quem mannis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem jumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelion Olympo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces montibus impositae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 253</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 14, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impositum saxis Anxur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeri raptos per inania vento Imposuit caelo,</quote> <trans><tr>placed them in the heavens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romulum) ablatum terris caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:811" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 811</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc metuens molemque et montes insuper altos Imposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem super cervicem jacentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec super imposuit liquidum aethera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei jus est in infinito supra suum aedificium imponere,</quote> <trans><tr>to build</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontibus praesidiisque impositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pons lapideus flumini impositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidvis oneris impone, impera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec peredit Impositam celer ignis Aetnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diadema imposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars togae, quae postea imponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 140</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n21980.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21980.4" n="1" level="3"> Naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to put on board ship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to embark;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid domi fuit in navem imposivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: in quas (naves)<cb n="IMPO" />  exercitus ejus imponi posset, Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones equitesque Brundisii in naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris magno pondere in naves imposito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 103, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nos in aeternum Exsilium impositura cymbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semel imposita est pictae Philomela carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 511</bibl></cit>.—With <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprehensis navibus circiter quinquaginta atque eo militibus inpositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 58, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaphas contexit, eoque milites imposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>. — With <case>abl.</case>: vetustissima nave impositi, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 66</bibl>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi expediti naves conscenderent, quo major numerus militum posset imponi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Crassus exercitum Brundisii imponeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa nostra velim imponas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per istos quae volebat clam imponenda curabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21980.5" n="2" level="3"> Med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to apply</hi> a remedy externally: <cit><quote lang="la">alium imponitur in vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porrum vulneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 6, 21, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raphanos super umbilicum contra tormenta vulvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 4, 13, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponuntur et per se folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 71, § 138</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21980.6" n="3" level="3"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> the male <hi rend="ital">to</hi> the female: <cit><quote lang="la">asinum equae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:36:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 36, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:5" default="NO">7, 2, 5</bibl>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:334" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 334</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n21980.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21980.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to impose; to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inflict upon; to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">give to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam omnem in med inponito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: cujus amicitia me paulatim in hanc perditam causam imposuit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne magnum onus observantiae Bruto nostro imponerem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Att, 13, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 56, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 23</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plus militi laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 18, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviores labores sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:74:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
