C. 3, 74, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi illud negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos mihi personam hanc imposuistis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 18, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi imposuisset aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego mihi necessitatem volui imponere hujus novae conjunctionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 12, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi impone istam vim, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:60:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 60, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 66</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagam mortiferam rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus injurias plurimas contumeliasque imposuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam sine ignominia alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 96</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitus fundo illi imposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. ad Caes. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. ad Caes. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli invidiam consuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges civitati per vim imposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saevas imponite leges, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:229" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis duras leges huic aetati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic praedae ac direptioni cellae nomen imponis,</quote> <trans><tr>assign</tr>, <tr>give</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:85:section=197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 85, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 47, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 39</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imponens cognata vocabula rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem imponere volumini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:146" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausulam disputationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:19:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: quasi perfectis summam eloquentiae manum imponerent, <hi rend="ital">gave the last touch to</hi>, Quint. prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: summam manum operi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:87:1" default="NO">2, 87, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl> prooem. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">extremam manum bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum supremam bellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum dolori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum divortiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">imponit finem sapiens et rebus honestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:444" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 444</bibl></cit> (453).—</sense><sense id="n21980.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21980.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set over</hi>, as overseer, commander, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si emimus, quem vilicum imponeremus, quem pecori praeficeremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul est impositus is nobis, quem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemonii devictis Atheniensibus triginta viros imposuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedoniae regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Masinissam in Syphacis regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cappadociae consularem rectorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si domini milites imperatoribus imponantur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 36, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque imposuistis cervicibus nostris sempiternum dominum (deum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit> (al. in cervicibus).—</sense><sense id="n21980.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impose upon</hi>, as a burden, tax, etc.: omnibus agris publicis pergrande vectigal. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal fructibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium victis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa genti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>; so, tributi aliquid<cb n="IMPO" />  alicui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 40</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tributum in capita singula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla onera nova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:49" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21980.12" n="3" level="3"> Alicui, <hi rend="ital">to impose upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi> (= frustror, fallo, fraudo, circumvenio): <cit><quote lang="la">Catoni egregie imposuit Milo noster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi imposuisset aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: populo imposuimus et oratores visi sumus, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 20</bibl> and 55: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectis Antigoni imposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile est barbato inponere regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falluntur quibus luxuria specie liberalitatis imponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 30</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque imponi vel dormienti posset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imporcitor: <entryFree id="n21981" type="main" key="Imporci^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Imporcĭtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Inp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>imporco</etym>, <sense id="n21981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity that presides over the drawing of furrows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius Pictor hos deos enumerat, quos invocat flamen sacrum Cereale faciens Telluri et Cereri ... Imporcitorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: Imporcitor qui porcas in agro facit arando. Porca autem est inter duos sulcos terra eminens, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=108" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 108</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
imporco: <entryFree id="n21982" type="main" key="imporco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imporco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), no <sense id="n21982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-porca</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to put into furrows;</hi> imporco <foreign lang="greek">au)lakizw,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">semen imporcatum occabimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
importabilis: <entryFree id="n21983" type="main" key="importa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">importābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inportabilis</etym>, <sense id="n21983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be borne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insupportable;</hi> lit. and trop. (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenium arietes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 2</bibl></cit> al. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">importābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an insupportable manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia contra eos facientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
importaticius: <entryFree id="n21984" type="hapax" key="importa_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">importātīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>importo</etym>, <sense id="n21984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brought in from abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imported</hi>: frumentum, Auct. B. Afr. 20, 4.</sense></entryFree>
importo: <entryFree id="n21985" type="main" key="importo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">importo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inporto</etym>, <sense id="n21985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">convey into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring in from abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to import</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n21985.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (D. Laelius) commeatus Bullide atque Amantia importari in oppidum prohibebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum ad se omnino importari non sinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ullam rem ad se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aere utuntur importato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum balinei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandines Septentrio importat et Corus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21985.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to introduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">importantur non merces solum adventiciae, sed etiam mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile patior, non esse nos transmarinis nec importatis artibus eruditos, sed genuinis domesticisque virtutibus, id. ib, 2, 15: si quid importetur nobis incommodi, propulsemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plura detrimenta publicis rebus quam adjumenta per homines eloquentissimos importata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitatem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestem aut incolumem famam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 28, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecunditatem feminis, rabiem viris (vinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium libellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(perturbationes animi) important aegritudines anxias atque acerbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 34</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fil. Fam. 16, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudem aut periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiam (crimen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
importune: <entryFree id="n21986" type="main" key="importu_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">importūnē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. importunus <sense id="n21986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
importunitas: <entryFree id="n21987" type="main" key="importu_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">importūnĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>importunus</etym>. <sense id="n21987.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">unsuitableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfitness</hi> (perh. only ante- and post - class., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">importunitatem spectate aniculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <trans><tr>dangerousness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21987.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of character, <hi rend="ital">unmannerliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incivility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impoliteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolence</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Cic.): importunitas et inhumanitas omni aetate molesta est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide inter importunitatem tuam senatusque bonitatem quid intersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:16:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 16, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta importunitas tantaque injuria Facta in nos est modo hic intus ab nostro ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">importunitas et superbia Tarquinii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">with superbia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo incredibili importunitate atque audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:30:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 30, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tuo scelere, importunitate, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 54</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">126: matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 69, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 61, 170</bibl></cit>: animal ex omnium <pb n="907" /> <cb n="IMPO" /> scelerum importunitate et omnium flagitiorum impunitate concretum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 27, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis, quantum importunitatis habent, parum est impune male fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
importunus: <entryFree id="n21988" type="main" key="importu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">importūnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from porto, qs. not conducive, not proper; opp. opportunus; hence</etym>, <sense id="n21988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconvenient</hi> (cf.: molestus, intempestivus, praeposterus). </sense><sense id="n21988.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">num importunum tempus in tanto otio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 20</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. inopportunum): <cit><quote lang="la">aggeribus turribusque et aliis machinationibus locus inportunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">importuna locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:540" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 540</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Armeniam petunt, id temporis importunam, quia hiems occipiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: etenim est in eo loco sedes huic nostro non importuna sermoni, Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi quidem regere patriam aut parentis importunum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21988.2" n="II" level="1"> ln partic., pregn. </sense><sense id="n21988.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grievous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dangerous</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quom illi inportunam tempestatem conciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque alius importunior acutiorque morbus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caphareus,</quote> <trans><tr>stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 481</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21988.4" n="B" level="2"> With respect to character, <hi rend="ital">indecorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmannerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncivil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">churlish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi> (class.; syn.: crudelis, immanis; opp. clemens). </sense><sense id="n21988.5" n="1" level="3"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">tam enim esse clemens tyrannus quam rex importunus potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">importunus atque amens tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:40:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 40, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelis atque importuna mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 63, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam importunus tamque crudelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelissimus atque importunissimus tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor importuna atque incommoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">importunissimus hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decemviri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebeii quam fuerint importuni, vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locutores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dives et importunus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripiet curule cui volet importunus ebur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 470</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ales (bubo), i. e. infausta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 864</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21988.6" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">immanis atque importuna natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 50</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">111: clades civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis famesque argenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">importuna atque audax argutia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">importunē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">unsuitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseasonably; rudely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confidere suis testibus et importune insistere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immittere versum de Pyrrho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:16:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexare civitates tyrannica crudelitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insultare veritati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:6:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
importuosus: <entryFree id="n21989" type="main" key="importu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">importŭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-portuosus</etym>, <sense id="n21989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without a harbor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeva inportuosa Italiae litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula importuosissima omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impos: <entryFree id="n21990" type="main" key="impo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ŏtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-potis; cf. the opp., compos</etym>, <sense id="n21990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not master of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not possessed of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without power over</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo, animi impos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui est impos animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Lact. de Ira Dei, 21, 3: sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agm. 178" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agm. 178</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 22</bibl>; cf.: impos est, qui animi sui potens non est, qui animum suum in potestate non habet, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">impos sui amore caeco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agm. 117" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agm. 117</bibl></cit>: veritatis, <hi rend="ital">not partaking of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without</hi>, App. de Deo Socr. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> p. 43: <cit><quote lang="la">damni,</quote> <trans><tr>unable to bear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 274</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impositicius: <entryFree id="n21991" type="main" key="impo^si^ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏsĭtīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>impono</etym>, <sense id="n21991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laid on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">applied</hi> (anteand post-class.). </sense><sense id="n21991.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">canthari,</quote> <trans><tr>only laid on</tr>, <tr>not fastened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:41:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 41, § 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21991.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the primitive names applied to things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.; 10, § 61: causa, <hi rend="ital">ascribed</hi> (opp. naturalis and publica), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1:5:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 1, 5, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impositio: <entryFree id="n21992" type="main" key="impo^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏsĭtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, gramm. t. t., <sense id="n21992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the application</hi> of a name to a thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 5</bibl> Müll.; 10, § 51; § 61 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 115, § 141</bibl>, the true reading is in potione).</sense></entryFree>
imposititius: <entryFree id="n21993" type="main" key="impo^si^ti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏsĭtītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>impono</etym>, <sense id="n21993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prescribed</hi> (late Lat.): jus civile, <cb n="IMPO" /> imposititium, Fragm. Dosith. 2. ap. Huschke, Jurisp. Antejust. p. 404.</sense></entryFree>
impositivus: <entryFree id="n21994" type="hapax" key="impo^si^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏsĭtīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>impono</etym>, i. q. impositicius, <sense id="n21994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">applied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>primitive names</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 6, § 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impositor: <entryFree id="n21995" type="hapax" key="impo^si^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏsĭtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who applies a name</hi> to a thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
impositus: <entryFree id="n21996" type="main" key="impo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏsĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from impono.</entryFree>
impossibilis: <entryFree id="n21997" type="main" key="impossi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impossĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpossibilis</etym>, <sense id="n21997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impossible</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">impossibile aut potius infinitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impossibilia aggrediantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil impossibile arbitror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Herculi quasi impossibile imperaverit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impossibile est, ut alveus fluminis publici non sit publicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 11, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:98" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 98</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impossibilitas: <entryFree id="n21998" type="main" key="impossi^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impossĭbĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impossibilis</etym>, <sense id="n21998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impossibility</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 179</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
impostor: <entryFree id="n21999" type="main" key="impostor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impostor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>impono, II. B. 3.</etym>, <sense id="n21999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deceiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impostor</hi> (post-class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">planus, sycophanta), impostores aut mendaces aut litigiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:4:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 4, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">54, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 338</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impostura: <entryFree id="n22000" type="main" key="impostu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impostūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imposture</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:20:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 20, 3</bibl>; Treb. Gall. 12; Coll. Mos. et Rom. Leg. 2, 1.</sense></entryFree>
impostus: <entryFree id="n22001" type="main" key="impostus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impostus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. impono <sense id="n22001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impotabilis: <entryFree id="n22002" type="main" key="impo_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impōtābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-potabilis</etym>, <sense id="n22002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not drinkable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 78</bibl>; Mans. 5.</sense></entryFree>
impotens: <entryFree id="n22003" type="main" key="impo^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏtens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-potens</etym>, <sense id="n22003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">powerless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impotent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22003.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n22003.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque homini infanti aut impotenti injuste facta conducunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad opem impotentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:28:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 28, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Sall. Or. Licin.: (Juno) inulta cesserat impotens Tellure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22003.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having no power over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not master of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unable to control</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens impotens rerum suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equi impotentes regendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob sitim impotentes sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impotens irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:42:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 42, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al. —</sense><sense id="n22003.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">that is not master of himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbridled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">headstrong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi> (syn.: effrenatus, infrenus). </sense><sense id="n22003.5" n="A" level="2"> Of animated beings: <cit><quote lang="la">mea (amica) est impotens, procax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria eos ipsos ferociores impotentioresque reddit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impotens, iracundus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo impotentissim us, ardens odio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confidens, impotens, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius immodicus gloriae, insatiabilis, impotens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si contra impotentem suscepta est causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferox atque impotens mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militibus impotens,</quote> <trans><tr>violent</tr>, <tr>despotic towards the soldiers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22003.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(regina) quidlibet impotens Sperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22003.7" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">quae effrenatio impotentis animi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 8, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aut nullos animi motus aut non tam impotentes fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:35:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 35, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impotentissimus dominatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in multo impotentiorem subito rabiem accensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impotentissimae cogitationes (invidiae, avaritiae, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio (with saeva),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa mulierum (with pervicacia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:56:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 56, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 35, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 18</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏtenter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n22003.8" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Powerlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weakly</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">elephantos impotentius regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 48, 11</bibl></cit>.— More freq., but perh. not anteAug., </sense><sense id="n22003.9" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Passionately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intemperately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti magna potentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 42" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitare divisionem agrorum divitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4</bibl></cit>: regnare, Auct. B. Alex. 33. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae impotentissime fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impotenter: <entryFree id="n22004" type="main" key="impo^tenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏtenter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impotens <sense id="n22004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impotentia: <entryFree id="n22005" type="main" key="impo^tenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŏtentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impotens</etym>. * <sense id="n22005.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Inability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of wealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poverty</hi>: <cb n="IMPR" /> magis propter suam impotentiam se semper credunt neglegi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22005.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Want of moderation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">self-restraint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungovernableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionate behavior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fury</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">impotentia quaedam animi a temperantia et moderatione plurimum dissidens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 34</bibl></cit>; <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 35</bibl>: impotentia commotus animi, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 527, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam potentia sua ad impotentiam usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impotentiae exprobratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteranorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius astri Gregem aestuosa torret impotentia,</quote> <trans><tr>fiery violence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:62" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impraegno: <entryFree id="n22006" type="main" key="impraegno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impraegno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-praegno</etym>, <sense id="n22006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to impregnate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make pregnant</hi> (late Lat.; perh. only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): illa ab eo impregnata vidit in somnis per fauces introisse solem, etc., Myth. Vat. ap. Mai. Auct. Class. t. 3, p. 117.</sense></entryFree>
impraemeditatus: <entryFree id="n22007" type="main" key="impraeme^di^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impraemĕdĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-praemeditor</etym>, <sense id="n22007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unprepared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">visio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impraeparatus: <entryFree id="n22008" type="main" key="impraepa^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impraepărātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpraeparatus</etym>, <sense id="n22008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unprepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without preparation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Eph. 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impraepedite: <entryFree id="n22009" type="main" key="impraepe^di_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impraepĕdītē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-to</orth>, <sense id="n22009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
impraepeditus: <entryFree id="n22010" type="main" key="impraepe^di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impraepĕdītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-praepeditus</etym>, <sense id="n22010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unhindered</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cursu tendentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 5, 6</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without hinderance;</hi> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n22010.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">impraepedite</orth> <itype>abduxit</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 10, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n22010.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">impraepedito</orth> <itype>pergere</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impraeputiatus: <entryFree id="n22011" type="main" key="impraepu_ti^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impraepūtĭātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-praeputiatus</etym>, <sense id="n22011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having the prepuce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncircumcised</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 11</bibl>, acc. to Cor. 1, 7, 18.</sense></entryFree>
impraescientia: <entryFree id="n22012" type="main" key="impraesci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impraescĭentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-praescientia</etym>, <sense id="n22012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a not knowing beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of prescience</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">futuri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impraesentiarum: <entryFree id="n22013" type="main" key="impraesenti^a_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impraesentĭārum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from in praesentia rerum</etym>, <sense id="n22013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under present circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now</hi> (in the vulg. lang.; post-class. and not infrequent; syn.: pro temporibus, in praesentia, hodie): si quem socium impraesentiarum dixerit, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 144, 4</bibl>: multa, quae impraesentiarum bona videntur, C. Fann. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 960</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">impraesentiarum hoc interdicere non alienum fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 11, 16</bibl></cit> (al. in praesenti); *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque adeo hic sit impraesentiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 48, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco supersedebo impraesentiarum in his rebus orationem occupare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 49, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omitteret coepta impraesentiarum, quae tutius postea capesseret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id geo cum alias tum etiam nunc impraesentiarum usu experior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 359, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui Varrones vel Atacinus vel Terentius Plinii vel avunculus vel Secundus compositi impraesentiarum rusticabuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>at the present time</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl></cit>. Vid. Hand, Turs. III. p. 234 sq.</sense></entryFree>
impraestabilis: <entryFree id="n22014" type="main" key="impraesta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impraestābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in - praestabilis</etym>, <sense id="n22014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">useless</hi> (late Lat.), Firm. Math. 8, 29 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; Salv. Gub. Dei, 4, 11.</sense></entryFree>
impraevaricabilis: <entryFree id="n22015" type="main" key="impraeva_ri^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impraevārĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpraevarico</etym>, <sense id="n22015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be transgressed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Fuga Saec. 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impransus: <entryFree id="n22016" type="main" key="impransus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impransus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpransus</etym>, <sense id="n22016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has not breakfasted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia illo die impransus fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum hic impransi mecum disquirite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 257</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 29 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
imprecatio: <entryFree id="n22017" type="main" key="impre^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprĕcātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imprecor</etym>, <sense id="n22017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an invoking of evil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprecation</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">exsecraris illum et caput sanctum tibi dira imprecatione defigis,</quote> <trans><tr>curse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:35:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 35, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 94, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprecationes nefariae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22017.1" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat., in a good sense, a <hi rend="ital">prayer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontificis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 130</bibl></cit>, <gen>n.</gen> 2.</sense></entryFree>
imprecor: <entryFree id="n22018" type="main" key="impre^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprĕcor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n22018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [in-precor]. </sense><sense id="n22018.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To invoke on</hi> a person, <hi rend="ital">to call down upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to imprecate</hi> (perh. not anteAug.). </sense><sense id="n22018.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Of good wishes (rare): solito sermone salutem ei fuerat imprecatus, <hi rend="ital">had wished health to her</hi> (on sneezing), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui multos imprecamur annos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 97 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui bene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22018.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Of evil: litora litoribus contraria, fluctibus <pb n="908" /> <cb n="IMPR" /> undas lmprecor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 629</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diras Pompeio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tibi pro meritis et talibus imprecor ausis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:24:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 24, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:16:5" default="NO">3, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cal. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:27:1 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 6, 27, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n22018.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pray to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invoke</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">incrementa solis augusti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus pater est imprecandus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Helv. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imprensibilis: <entryFree id="n22019" type="hapax" key="imprensi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprensĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-prehendo</etym>, <sense id="n22019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impresse: <entryFree id="n22020" type="main" key="impresse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impressē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. imprimo <sense id="n22020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impressio: <entryFree id="n22021" type="main" key="impressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impressĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imprimo</etym>, <sense id="n22021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an impressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impression</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22021.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22021.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam signari impressione formarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 4</bibl></cit>: signaculi, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:68" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummorum,</quote> <trans><tr>stamping</tr>, <tr>coining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 2:25" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 2, 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22021.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22021.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An irruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non judicio neque disceptatione, sed vi atque impressione (aliquem) evertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 34, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes arbitrati occasionem se habere victoriae impressionem facere coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4</bibl></cit>. 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omni multitudine in fines Suessionum facerent impressionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:6:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 28, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 37, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22021.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pressure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violent handling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis impressio et tumentia provocat et dolorem geminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8:92" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22021.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A squeezing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pressure</hi> of a multitude, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad M. Caes. 5:30" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad M. Caes. 5, 30</bibl> Mai. — </sense><sense id="n22021.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22021.8" n="A" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">a division</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si numerosum est id in omnibus sonis et vocibus, quod habet quasdam impressiones et quod metiri possumus intervallis aequalibus,</quote> <trans><tr>divisions of time</tr>, <tr>beats</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 185</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22021.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a marked expression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emphasis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lingua explanata vocum impressio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22021.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The impression on the mind</hi> made by phenomena: <cit><quote lang="la">cum visa in animis imprimantur, non vos id dicere, inter ipsas impressiones nihil interesse, sed inter species et quasdam formas eorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impressus: <entryFree id="n22022" type="main" key="impressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impressus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from imprimo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22023" type="main" key="impressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impressus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-pressus</etym>, <sense id="n22023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not milked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">missus et impressis haedus ab uberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34:70" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22024" type="hapax" key="impressus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impressus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>imprimo</etym>, <sense id="n22024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub pectoris impressu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 273</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impretiabilis: <entryFree id="n22025" type="main" key="impre^ti^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprĕtĭābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpretium</etym>, <sense id="n22025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">priceless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invaluable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inestim tble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanitatis munus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notitia litterarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 1</bibl></cit> al.</sense></entryFree>
imprimis: <entryFree id="n22026" type="main" key="impri_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprīmis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. primus, II. B.</entryFree>
imprimo: <entryFree id="n22027" type="main" key="impri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprĭmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>pressi, pressum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-premo</etym>, <sense id="n22027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stamp</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dig into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to impress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprint</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22027.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in ejusmodi cera centum sigilla hoc anulo impressero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus ubi vestigium impresserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 27, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 15, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus rostro si humi A litteram impresserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne imprimatur jacentibus molibus solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: imprimitque genae genam, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 686</bibl> (Trag. v. 436): <cit><quote lang="la">os cucurbitulae corpori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa tabellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impressit dente labris notam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 13, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muris aratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stigmata captivorum frontibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Dido) os impressa toro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impressa orbita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcus altius impressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 23, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monimenta impressa saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puteum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to sink</tr>, <tr>dig</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudo ecce jugulum, convertite huc manus, imprimite mucrones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">morsum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:33" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 37, § 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to make</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">basia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:42:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">staminaque impresso fatalia pollice nentes,</quote> <trans><tr>pressed upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 453</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">impressoque genu nitens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humidaque impressa siccabat lumina lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit> (4, 5), 17: <cit><quote lang="la">exempta scutula cortici, imprimitur ex alia cortex par,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 16, 26, § 118</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22027.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: aliquid (aliqua re), <hi rend="ital">to press in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give an impression to</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to engrave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stamp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>: an imprimi quasi ceram <cb n="IMPR" /> animum putamus? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc munus habebis, Cratera impressum signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 536</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">impressas auro quas gesserat olim Exuvias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>embroidered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non levior cippus nunc imprimit ossa?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:37" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transtra per et remos impressaque terga virorum,</quote> <trans><tr>pressed down</tr>, <tr>bended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:403" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 403</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22027.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to impress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engrave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stamp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in omnium animis eorum notionem impressisset ipsa natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 16, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">visa in animis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeque in animis imprimuntur incohatae intellegentiae, similiter in omnibus imprimuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:10:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:19:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 19, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum illud quidem impressum in animo atque mente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi omnes ii motus in ipso oratore impressi esse atque inusti videbuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo e genere nobis notitiae rerum imprimuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (curriculis) Platonis primum sunt impressa vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(memoria) constat ex notis litterarum, et ex eo, in quo imprimuntur illae notae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menti impressa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam vestigia animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria publica recensionis tabulis publicis impressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impressa animo rudi memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum lectione duplex imprimeretur rei publicae dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fortitudinis, tum vero humanitatis ... impressa vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22027.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to stamp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum flagitiorum iste vestigiis omnia municipia, praefecturas ... impressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">impressē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forcibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impressively</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n22027.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dehinc rursus defricandus tenacius quidem, sed non impressius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:7:87" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 7, 87</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22027.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte et impresse recogitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. Cast. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut impressius dixerim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Car. Christ. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
