imprincipaliter: <entryFree id="n22028" type="main" key="imprinci^pa_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprincĭpālĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n22028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by preference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9:55" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
improbabilis: <entryFree id="n22029" type="main" key="impro^ba_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inprobabilis</etym>, <sense id="n22029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not deserving of approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">objectionable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceptionable</hi> (not ante-Aug.; for in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 33</bibl>, the correct read. is probabilem; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 2</bibl>): rationes, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum per se improbabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non improbabilis mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:14:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">objectionably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">objecta non improbabiliter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
improbatio: <entryFree id="n22030" type="main" key="impro^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>improbo</etym>, <sense id="n22030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disapprobation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blame</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">haec et ad improbationem et approbationem testium pertinebunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:74:section=172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 74, § 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatoris erit, improbatione hominis uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 10, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improbator: <entryFree id="n22031" type="main" key="impro^ba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disapprover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condemner</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">malorum, bonorum probator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improbe: <entryFree id="n22032" type="main" key="impro^be_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. improbus <sense id="n22032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
improbitas: <entryFree id="n22033" type="main" key="impro^bi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>improbus</etym>, <sense id="n22033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">badness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wickedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depravity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonesty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improbity</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum te alicujus improbitas perversitasque commoverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum neglectio improbitatem coarguit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac causa improbitatem et gratiam cum inopia et veritate contendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 27, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:224" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum me improbitatis patrocinium suscipere vultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judici invisa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordis humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 676</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodiga corruptoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:305" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illo admirabilis aevo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22033.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of bad, troublesome animals, <hi rend="ital">impudence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">audacity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simiae Dodoneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muscae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alitum semina depascentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improbiter: <entryFree id="n22034" type="main" key="impro^bi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. improbus <sense id="n22034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
improbito: <entryFree id="n22035" type="main" key="impro^bi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>improbo</etym>, <sense id="n22035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disapprove strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condemn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud inhumaniter scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improbo: <entryFree id="n22036" type="main" key="impro^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. in-probo</etym>, <sense id="n22036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disapprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condemn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi> (class.; syn.: culpo, vitupero, <cb n="IMPR" /> criminor, etc.): multi, qui domi aetatem agerent, propterea sunt improbati, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6</bibl> (Trag. v. 296 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc negas te. posse nec approbare nec improbare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec improbantur a Peripateticis, a Stoicis defenduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ista studia non improbo, moderata modo sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbantur ii quaestus, qui in odia hominum incurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curio utrumque improbans consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per improbaturum haec Jovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>to reject</tr>, <tr>rescind</tr>, <tr>make void</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 68</bibl></cit>: ego frumentum neque attigi neque aspexi: mancipibus potestatem probandi improbandique permisi, <hi rend="ital">of rejecting as unsuitable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">insufficient</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 76</bibl>, § 175; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 2, 74, § 172: ut aut ne cogeret munire aut id, quod munitum esset, ne improbaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vergilius terram, quae filicem ferat, non inprobat vitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 29</bibl></cit>: dibapha Tyria P. Lentulus primus in praetexta usus improbabatur, <hi rend="ital">was censured</hi>, Nep. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 63, § 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Nymphae) ad numerum motis pedibus duxere choreas. Improbat has pastor, saltuque imitatus agresti, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>derides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 521</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in law, <hi rend="ital">to overrule</hi> an opinion or judgment: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:51" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:71 al" default="NO">3, 71 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui si improbasset, cur ferri passus esset? sin probasset, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde invident humiliores, rident superiores, improbant boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:14" default="NO">1, 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
improbulus: <entryFree id="n22037" type="hapax" key="impro^bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n22037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [improbus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat wicked</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
improbus: <entryFree id="n22038" type="main" key="impro^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inprobus</etym>, <sense id="n22038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not according to the standard.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22038.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22038.2" n="A" level="2"> Below the standard, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of bad quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inferior</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly post-Aug.): merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera araneorum et textura inproba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbiores postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua sum opera et propter te inprobior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22038.3" n="B" level="2"> Above or beyond the standard, i. e. <hi rend="ital">enormous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">monstrous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:510" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 510</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:631" default="NO">2, 631</bibl> (cf. Forbig. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 119</bibl>; Orell. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 22</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Chilones a labris improbioribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 78</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegmina plantae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:702" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbo somno, quem nec tertia saepe rumpit hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villus barbarum in capris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reptatus (vitium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:838" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 838</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber improbior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (in Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 366, 13</bibl>; Hist. Fragm. 4, 40 Dietsch, the true read. is in prora).—</sense><sense id="n22038.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of mind and character. </sense><sense id="n22038.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Restless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indomitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persistent</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pervicax, perstans, vehemens, acer): labor omnia vincit improbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum cornix plena pluviam vocat improba voce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatit improbus hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 767</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:105:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 105, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22038.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Morally bad; wicked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprobate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandoned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungodly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unjust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonest; bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudent; violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outrageous</hi> (syn.: malus, malignus, pravus, depravatus, nequam). </sense><sense id="n22038.7" n="1" level="3"> Of living beings: NI TESTIMONIVM FARIATVR IMPROBVS INTESTABILISQVE ESTO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui improbi essent et scelesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequam et improbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vero improbi esse hominis et perfidiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:73:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 73, 297</bibl></cit>: Cresphontes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 24, 38</bibl> (Trag. v. 156 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">populum aut inflammare in improbos aut incitatum in bonos mitigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe post natos homines improbisssimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:224" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in me tam improbus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ingenio est improbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alias res est impense improbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat improbus et te Neglegit, aut horret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eum, qui sit improbus, latronem dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:21" default="NO">1, 8, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anguis) piscibus atram inprobus ingluviem explet,</quote> <trans><tr>voracious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis ales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annis,</quote> <trans><tr>by his youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:282" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortuna arridens infantibus,</quote> <trans><tr>mischievous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:605" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 605</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inprobior satiram scribente cinaedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:106" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 106</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n22038.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: conubii, Stat. Th. <pb n="909" /> <cb n="IMPR" /> 7, 300. — </sense><sense id="n22038.9" n="2" level="3"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">improbo Iracundior Hadria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavit improba taeter Ora (leonis) cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfricare faciem et quasi improbam facere,</quote> <trans><tr>shameless</tr>, <tr>impudent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oris improbi homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improba non fuerit si mea charta, dato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:24:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satureia,</quote> <trans><tr>exciting lust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:75:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 75, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio improbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <trans><tr>licentious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:686" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 796</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:441" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis improbissimae poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>illegal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:42:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 42, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala et improba defensio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">101: amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 412</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 24</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">improbus, turpis, Schol. Cruq. ad loc.): spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improba ventris rabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo apertior adulatio, quo improbior, hoc citius expugnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">improba quamvis gratia fallaci praetoris vicerit urna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:3" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in two forms, <orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏbē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">improbĭter</orth> (perh. only once in <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 66</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n22038.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Beyond measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enormously</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ad eos, quibus intestinum improbe prominet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 31 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quodam procerae staturae improbiusque nato,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>uncommonly well furnished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chilones improbius labrati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 78</bibl></cit> P. —</sense><sense id="n22038.11" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Badly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improperly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa scelerate, multa audacter, multa improbe fecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus improbe datum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego miror, si quid ab improbis de me improbe dicitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda improbe parta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:95" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non improbe litigabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorantia et inscitia improbe dicentium, quae non intellegunt,</quote> <trans><tr>incorrectly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with indocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">estne aliquid, quod improbius fieri possit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 60, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decerpere oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 126</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (res) improbissime fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improcerus: <entryFree id="n22039" type="main" key="impro_ce_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōcērus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in - procerus</etym>, <sense id="n22039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not tall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undersized</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:19:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improcreabilis: <entryFree id="n22040" type="hapax" key="impro_cre^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōcrĕābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-procreabilis</etym>, <sense id="n22040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be procreated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improdictus: <entryFree id="n22041" type="main" key="impro_dictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōdictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-prodictus</etym>, <sense id="n22041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not postponed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne improdicta die quis accusetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 17, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improfessus: <entryFree id="n22042" type="main" key="impro^fessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏfessus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-professus</etym>. <sense id="n22042.0" n="I" level="1"> M i d., <hi rend="ital">that has not professed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">declared himself</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">deferebantur, qui vel improfessi Judaicam intra Urbem viverent vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n22042.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is not professed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">declared</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 341" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 341</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
improles: <entryFree id="n22043" type="gloss" key="impro_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōles</orth> <itype>est qui nondum vir est</itype>, Mar. Victor. p. 2465 P.; cf. improles, <foreign lang="greek">a)/gonos, a)/teknos,</foreign> Gloss.</entryFree>
improlus: <entryFree id="n22044" type="gloss" key="impro_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōlus</orth> vel <orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōlis</orth>, <itype>qui nondum esset ascriptus in civitate</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=108" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 108</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
impromiscus: <entryFree id="n22045" type="main" key="impro_miscu^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōmiscŭs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2 in-promiscus</etym>, <sense id="n22045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmingled</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">suavitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum neque numeris neque generibus praeserviens, sed liberum undique et impromiscum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impromptus: <entryFree id="n22046" type="main" key="impromptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impromptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, um. <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-promptus</etym>, <sense id="n22046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not quick</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">infacundior et lingua impromptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprompto jam Arminio ob continua pericla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermone impromptus Latio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imprope: <entryFree id="n22047" type="main" key="impro^pe^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏpĕ</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>in-prope</etym>, <sense id="n22047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">near</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">imprope est caelo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improperanter: <entryFree id="n22048" type="main" key="impro^pe^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏpĕranter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. inproperanter</etym>, <sense id="n22048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gradually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by degrees</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. 35, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
improperatus: <entryFree id="n22049" type="hapax" key="impro^pe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏpĕrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-properatus</etym>, <sense id="n22049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not hastened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lingering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 798</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improperium: <entryFree id="n22050" type="main" key="impro^pe^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏpĕrĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. impropero</etym>, <sense id="n22050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taunt</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 18, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:15:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 15, 3 al.</bibl>; cf. improperium <foreign lang="greek">o)nei/disis,</foreign> Gloss. Philox. <cb n="IMPR" /></sense></entryFree>
impropero: <entryFree id="n22051" type="hapax" key="impro^pe^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏpĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-propero</etym>, <sense id="n22051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hasten into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter hastily</hi>: quo si quis improperet, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22052" type="main" key="impro^pe^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏpĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n22052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [corrupt. for improbro; from in - probrum], <hi rend="ital">to cast as a reproach upon</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">to reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upbraid</hi> (post-Aug., and very rare): impropero <foreign lang="greek">o)neidizw,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">non impropero illi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improperia improperantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrones improperabant ei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 27, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improperus: <entryFree id="n22053" type="hapax" key="impro^pe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprŏpĕrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-properus</etym>, <sense id="n22053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not hasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:96" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improprie: <entryFree id="n22054" type="main" key="impro_^pri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprō^prĭē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. improprius <sense id="n22054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
improprietas: <entryFree id="n22055" type="main" key="impro_^pri^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprō^prĭĕtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>improprius</etym>, <sense id="n22055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impropriety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improper use</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improprius: <entryFree id="n22056" type="main" key="impro_^pri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprō^prĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-proprius</etym>, <sense id="n22056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not befitting</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">unsuitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improper</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec improprium nec inusitatum nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cognomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tropus maxime improprius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impropri-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">something improper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impropriety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faultiness</hi>: ei (proprietati) contrarium est vitium; id apud nos improprium, <foreign lang="greek">a)/kuron</foreign> apud Graecos vocatur, quale est: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantum sperare dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciam us, nihil ornatum esse, quod sit improprium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:46" default="NO">1, 5, 46</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:10" default="NO">2, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:20" default="NO">10, 3, 20</bibl>; 12, 10, 42. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">im-propriē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">improperly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:1:1" default="NO">17, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impropugnatus: <entryFree id="n22057" type="main" key="impro_pugna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōpugnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-propugnatus</etym>, <sense id="n22057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not defended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undefended</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">26, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
improspectus: <entryFree id="n22058" type="main" key="improspectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">improspectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-prospectus</etym>, <sense id="n22058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not seen from afar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseen</hi>: Aetna, Auct. Carm. Aetn. 339.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">improspectē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">improvidently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jephte improspecte voverat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improsper: <entryFree id="n22059" type="main" key="improsper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">improsper</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>spĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-prosper</etym>, <sense id="n22059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprosperous</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles insidiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa claritudine generis sed improspera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 44</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">improspĕrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unfortunately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 9, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
improspicuus: <entryFree id="n22060" type="gloss" key="improspi^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">improspĭcŭus</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)peri/bleptos,</foreign> Gloss. Graec. Lat.</entryFree>
improtectus: <entryFree id="n22061" type="main" key="impro_tectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōtectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-protectus</etym>, <sense id="n22061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncovered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undefended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprotected</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne improtectum Mesopotamiae relinqueret latus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">31, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imparatus improtectusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:44" default="NO">7, 3, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
improvide: <entryFree id="n22062" type="main" key="impro_vi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōvĭdē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. improvidus <sense id="n22062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
improvidentia: <entryFree id="n22063" type="main" key="impro_vi^denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōvĭdentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>improvidus</etym>, <sense id="n22063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improvidence</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">improvidentia sententias vertere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
improvidus: <entryFree id="n22064" type="main" key="impro_vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōvĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-providus</etym>, <sense id="n22064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not foreseeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not anticipating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improvident</hi> (class.; syn.: incautus, imprudens, inconsultus). </sense><sense id="n22064.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improvidos incautosque hostes opprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum mentes occupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens improvida aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas puerorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:939" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 939</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela, quae et ipsa caeca et improvida feruntur,</quote> <trans><tr>aimless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festinatio inprovida est et caeca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22064.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">futuri certaminis Romanus veniebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis et improvida hujus mali civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 3, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Vitellius) ignarus militiae, improvidus consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 56</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n22064.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta improvida servasse spatium campi distantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:286" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 286</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōvĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">improvidently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in praeceps dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 27, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
improvise: <entryFree id="n22065" type="main" key="impro_vi_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōvīsē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōvīso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <sense id="n22065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. improvisus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
improvisus: <entryFree id="n22066" type="main" key="impro_vi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōvīsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-provisus</etym>, <sense id="n22066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not foreseen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unforeseen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpected</hi><cb n="IMPR" />  (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sapienti nihil improvisum accidere potest, nihil inopinatum, nihil omnino novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde iste amor tam improvisus ac tam repentinus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot bella subito atque improvisa nascantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:14:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improvisior pestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castella munita improviso adventu capta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 27, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagoque remenso Improvisi aderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctisque repente Improvisus ait,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 595</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n22066.1" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōvīsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is unforeseen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an emergency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux sibi delectos retinuerat ad improvisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—Mostly in <case>abl.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, adverbially, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suddenly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi de improviso respice ad eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. Trabea ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 31, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 151</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de improviso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 39, 1</bibl>; 6, 3, 1 et saep. — Less freq. with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex improviso filiam inveni meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:43:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 43, § 112</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms, <orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōvīso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">imprōvīsē</orth> (post-class.), <hi rend="ital">on a sudden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">improviso filiam inveni (for which, shortly before: ex improviso filiam inveni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane homini praeter opinionem improviso incidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improviso eos in castra irrupisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum adest boni improviso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mihi nihil improviso evenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl>, A, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">scalae improviso, subitusque apparuit ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 576</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 524</bibl>: improvise necans incautos morte suprema, Tert. poët. adv. Marc. 2, 12.</sense></entryFree>
imprudens: <entryFree id="n22067" type="main" key="impru_dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprūdens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inprudens</etym>, <sense id="n22067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not foreseeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not anticipating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unaware</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inadvertent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprudent</hi> (class.; syn.: inconsideratus, incautus, improvidus). </sense><sense id="n22067.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites missi nocte iter conficiunt, imprudentes atque inopinantes hostes aggrediuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 38, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites imprudentibus omnibus de improviso advolasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:36:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 36, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia imprudente L. Sulla facta esse certe scio,</quote> <trans><tr>without the knowledge of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripsi etiam illud quodam in libello, qui me imprudente et invito excidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">namque tu me inprudentem obrepseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus hodie boni feci imprudens quam sciens ante hunc diem umquam,</quote> <trans><tr>unconsciously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens,</quote> <trans><tr>inexperienced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probe horum facta imprudens depinxit senex,</quote> <trans><tr>without knowing it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi imprudens M. Servilium praeterisse videare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:77:269" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 77, 269</bibl></cit> (cf. the opp. prudens praetereo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 88</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">qua (definitione) tu etiam imprudens utebare nonnumquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex prima statim fronte dijudicare imprudentium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:40" default="NO">7, 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam imprudentibus imber Obfuit, i. e. ignaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 373</bibl></cit> Serv. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">non imprudens consilium, si aditum haberet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102, 3</bibl></cit>: ne casu inprudentes suae naves in classem adversariorum inciderent, Auct. B. Afr. 11, 4.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid horum ab imprudentioribus fiet (fieri autem nisi ab imprudentibus non potest), neglegendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa facit (sapiens), quae ab imprudentissimis aut aeque fieri videmus aut peritius aut exercitatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 19:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Const. Sap. 19, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22067.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprudentes legis,</quote> <trans><tr>ignorant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">frons tenera imprudensque laborum,</quote> <trans><tr>that has not experienced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 372</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitatis imprudens consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n22067.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non imprudens usurum eum rabie, qua, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">imprūdenter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">without foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknowingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprudently</hi>: etsi te nihil temere, nihil imprudenter facturum judicaram, <pb n="910" /> <cb n="IMPU" /> Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8</bibl>, B, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,023:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Han. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Codrus) imprudenter rixam ciens interemptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad flammam accessit imprudentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imprudentia: <entryFree id="n22068" type="main" key="impru_denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imprūdentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inpr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imprudens</etym>, <sense id="n22068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of foresight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderateness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprudence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inadvertence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantusque ab imprudentia eventus utraque castra tenuit pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 39, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo modo prudentia esset, nisi foret contra imprudentia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter imprudentiam, ut ignosceretur, petiverunt ... ignoscere imprudentiae dixit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:27:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 27, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 29, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 112, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprudentia est, cum scisse aliquid is, qui arguitur, negatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 27, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui perperam judicassent, quod saepe per imprudentiam fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:23:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inculcamus per imprudentiam saepe etiam minus usitatos (versus in oratione), sed tamen versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:189" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 56, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo ne per imprudentiam quidem errare potest, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprudentia teli emissi brevius propriis verbis exponi non potuit,</quote> <trans><tr>aimlessness</tr>, <tr>want of purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 158</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impubes: <entryFree id="n22069" type="main" key="impu_bes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūbes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ĕris, and</itype> (more freq., but not in Cic. or Cæs.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">impūbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (form -es, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:239" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 239</bibl>; <sense id="n22069.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">form -is,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 417</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 416</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 673</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 751</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 382</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:43 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 43 al.</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-pubes</etym>, <hi rend="ital">not having attained to manhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">below the age of puberty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">youthful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beardless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium ejus impuberem in carcere necatum esse dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de servis liberisque omnibus ad impuberes supplicium sumit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:239" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitemque impubis luli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec impubem parentes Troïlon Flevere semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus impubium impositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 9, § 41</bibl></cit>.— Esp. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impūbes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>com.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">productis omnibus elegisse impubes dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.—Freq. as leg. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a person under years of discretion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impuberes quidem in tutela esse omnium civitatum jure contingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:189" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an impubes rem alienam amovendo furtum faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 3:208" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 208</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22069.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 751</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 417</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22069.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">celibate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chaste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui diutissime impuberes permanserunt, maximam inter suos ferunt laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impubescens: <entryFree id="n22070" type="hapax" key="impu_bescens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūbescens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inpubesco</etym>, <sense id="n22070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">growing to maturity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortex (caprifici),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impudens: <entryFree id="n22071" type="main" key="impu^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭdens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-pudens</etym>, <sense id="n22071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudent</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">impudicus, inverecundus): probus improbum (fraudasse dicatur), pudens impudentem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: arioli, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl> (Trag. v. 356 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">statuite exemplum impudenti, date pudori praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illac impudente audacius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum impudens fuisset in facto, tum impudentior videretur, si negaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudens liqui patrios Penates, Impudens Qrcum moror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:49 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 49 sq.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">o hominis impudentem audaciam!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aspicias, os inpudens videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacium!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 60, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te quidem edepol nihil est impudentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudentissima oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: impudentissimum nomen, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 327, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante Bibuli impudentissimas litteras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭdenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">shamelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio haec impudenter negas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: batuit, impudenter (dicitur); <cit><quote lang="la">depsit, multo impudentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homo impudentissime mentiretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:7:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 7, § 16</bibl></cit>. <cb n="IMPU" /></sense></entryFree>
impudenter: <entryFree id="n22072" type="main" key="impu^denter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭdenter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impudens <sense id="n22072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impudentia: <entryFree id="n22073" type="main" key="impu^denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭdentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impudens</etym>, <sense id="n22073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shamelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudence</hi> (class.): qui illius impudentiam norat et duritudinem, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 20</bibl>: quis homo te exsuperavit usquam gentium impudentiā? Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:36:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 36, 77</bibl> (Trag. v. 262 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudentia atque audacia fretus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 15, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam volitare in foro, etc.... cum omnino, quid suum, quid alienum sit, ignoret, insignis est impudentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:238" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 238 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: libidinis, Plin 34, 3, 6, § 12.</sense></entryFree>
impudicatus: <entryFree id="n22074" type="gloss" key="impu^di_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭdīcātus</orth> <itype>stupratus, impudicus factus</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=109" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 109</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
impudice: <entryFree id="n22075" type="main" key="impu^di_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭdīcē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impudicus <sense id="n22075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impudicitia: <entryFree id="n22076" type="main" key="impu^di_ci^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭdīcĭtĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impudicus</etym>, <sense id="n22076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchasteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immodesty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lewdness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 17</bibl>.—Esp., of unnatural vice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22076.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = impudentia, <hi rend="ital">shamelessness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio fide hercle erili ut soleat inpudicitia opprobrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
