impudicus: <entryFree id="n22077" type="main" key="impu^di_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭdīcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpudicus</etym>. <sense id="n22077.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Shameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudent</hi> ( = impudens; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): o facinus impudicum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">1, 2, 27: crura defringentur, ni istum inpudicum percies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22077.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unchaste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immodest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lewd</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word): <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Quod id est facinus? <hi rend="ital">Sc.</hi> Inpudicum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tu inpudicam esse arbitrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me inpudicam facere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to rob of chastity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes adulteri, omnes impuri impudicique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerabile est servire impuro, impudico, effeminato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et consul et impudicissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">osculando impudicior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22077.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the middle finger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:70:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 70, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fur veneris, impudicus ibis,</quote> <trans><tr>violated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor impudicus urcei,</quote> <trans><tr>disgusting</tr>, <tr>filthy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 16</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭdīcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unchastely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudicissime et obscenissime vixit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impugnatio: <entryFree id="n22078" type="main" key="impugna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impugnātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impugno</etym>, <sense id="n22078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Isa. 5, 18, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impugnator: <entryFree id="n22079" type="main" key="impugna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impugnātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who attacks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assails</hi> (late Lat.; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 15, 8</bibl>, the true read. is oppugnatores), Cassiod. Var. i. q. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 13, 6.</sense></entryFree>
impugnatus: <entryFree id="n22080" type="main" key="impugna_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impugnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from impugno.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22081" type="hapax" key="impugna_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impugnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-pugnatus</etym>, <sense id="n22081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not attacked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unassailed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe est rhetori, si quid in mala causa destitutum atque impugnatum relinquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impugno: <entryFree id="n22082" type="main" key="impugno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impugno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-pugno</etym>, <sense id="n22082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fight against</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi> (class.; esp. in the transf. and trop. signif.; cf.: invado, opprimo, aggredior, adorior). </sense><sense id="n22082.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in the milit. sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">terga hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 70, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syracusae a cive impugnatae sunt (for which, shortly after, oppugnari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 2</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: nostri redintegratis viribus acrius impugnare coeperunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 26, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22082.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the milit. sphere, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impugn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Scaurus) tametsi a principio acerrime regem (Jugurtham) impugnaverat, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus vel praecipua opera Bibulum impugnaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneficiis et devotionibus impugnari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe quae in aliis litibus impugnarunt actores causarum, eadem in aliis defendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii caput palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: dignitatem alicujus, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 439, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:53:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 53, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meritum et fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finitionem alterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 14</bibl>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illis id tempus impugnandi detur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impulsio: <entryFree id="n22083" type="main" key="impulsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impulsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impello</etym>, <sense id="n22083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pushing against.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22083.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">external pressure</hi>,<cb n="IMPU" />  <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis coagmentatio corporis vel calore vel frigore vel aliqua impulsione vehementi labefactatur et frangitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22083.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impulse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22083.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsio est, quae sine cogitatione per quandam affectionem animi facere aliquid hortatur, ut amor, iracundia, aegritudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 19; 2, 6, 20.— </sense><sense id="n22083.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: ad hilaritatem impulsio, <hi rend="ital">pleasantry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an incitement to merriment</hi>, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xarientismo/s,</foreign> a figure of speech, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:3" default="NO">9, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impulsor: <entryFree id="n22084" type="main" key="impulsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impulsor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>impello</etym>, <sense id="n22084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who incites</hi> or <hi rend="ital">instigates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inciter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigator</hi> (rare but class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor, hortator, monitor): quamvis non fueris suasor et impulsor profectionis meae, approbator certe fuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se auctores et impulsores et socios habuisse sceleris illius eos viros, quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 18</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me impulsore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impulstrix: <entryFree id="n22085" type="gloss" key="impulstrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impulstrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impulsor; analog. with defenstrix, assestrix, possestrix, tonstrix, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n22085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who instigates</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impulsus: <entryFree id="n22086" type="main" key="impulsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impulsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from impello.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22087" type="main" key="impulsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impulsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>impello</etym>, <sense id="n22087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pushing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">striking against.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22087.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an outward pressure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an impulse</hi> (class.; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">impulsu scutorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (natura) a primo impulsu moveatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 25</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is ardor non alieno impulsu, sed sua sponte movetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:12:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 12, 32</bibl></cit>: ventus, qui inferiora repentinis impulsibus quatit, App. de Mundo, p. 62.—</sense><sense id="n22087.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi duxere impulsu vostro, vostro impulsu easdem exigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 4, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsos non negare, ad haec bona Chrysogonum accessisse impulsu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:37:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsu patrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne civitas eorum impulsu deficeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsu patrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui simili impulsu aliquid commiserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio pondere modo et impulsu proeliatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatis subiti et vehementes impulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impulvereus: <entryFree id="n22088" type="hapax" key="impulve^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impulvĕrĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-pulvereus</etym>, <sense id="n22088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without dust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulverea incruentaque victoria,</quote> <trans><tr>without trouble</tr>, <tr>easy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:6:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 6, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impunctus: <entryFree id="n22089" type="hapax" key="impunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impunctus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-punctus</etym>, <sense id="n22089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without points</hi> or <hi rend="ital">specks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crystallum,</quote> <trans><tr>clear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impune: <entryFree id="n22090" type="main" key="impu_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūnē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impunis <sense id="n22090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impunis: <entryFree id="n22091" type="main" key="impu_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūnis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-poena</etym>, <sense id="n22091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpunished</hi> (in the <pos>adj.</pos> very rare, and perh. only post-class.; but in the <pos>adv.</pos> freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n22091.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impunem me fore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 132, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier impunis rediit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> (dub.; Mommsen immunis).— Hence, </sense><sense id="n22091.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impūne</orth> (archaic orthog. impoene, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad Anton. Aug. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad Anton. Aug. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Mai.), <hi rend="ital">without punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without fear of punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with impunity</hi>: ita inductum est male facere impoene, bene facere non impoene licere, Cato, l. l.: aliquid facere, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 100 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">optimum est facere (injuriam), impune si possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id Sextilius factum negabat, poterat autem impune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem occidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multos libros surripuisset nec se impune laturum putaret, aufugit,</quote> <trans><tr>escape unpunished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:77:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 77, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non impune tamen scelus hoc sinit esse Lyaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si amanti inpune facere quod lubeat licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem istuc impune habueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tantum maleficium impune habendum,</quote> <trans><tr>be left unpunished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum nostrorum labore factum est, ut impune in otio esse possemus,</quote> <trans><tr>with safety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercator ter et quater Anno revisens aequor Atlanticum Impune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(capellae) Impune per nemus quaerunt thyma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 14, 36, § 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta arguebantur, dicta impune erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl></cit>; <pb n="911" /> <cb n="IMPU" /> 12, 54 Draeger: <cit><quote lang="la">recitare,</quote> <trans><tr>without retaliation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crederem mihi impunius licere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertate usus est, quo impunius dicax esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in metu et periculo cum creduntur facilius, tum finguntur impunius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 27, 58</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impunissime Tibi quidem hercle vendere hasce aedes licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impunitas: <entryFree id="n22092" type="main" key="impu_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūnĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impunis</etym>, <sense id="n22092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">freedom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safety from punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impunity</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venia, obsequentia): quis ignorat maximam illecebram esse peccandi impunitatis spem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem si vicisset, habiturus esset impunitatem et licentiam sempiternam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impunitatem alicui dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum impunitas fuit non modo a judicio, sed etiam a sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impunitatem desertoris petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tanta praesertim gladiorum sit impunitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impunitas peccatorum data videtur eis, qui ignominiam et infamiam ferunt sine dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superfluens juvenili quadam dicendi impunitate et licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">crebrescebat licentia atque impunitas asyla statuendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impunite: <entryFree id="n22093" type="main" key="impu_ni_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūnītē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impunitus <sense id="n22093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impunitus: <entryFree id="n22094" type="main" key="impu_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūnītus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">impoenī-tus</orth>; cf. impune), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-punitus</etym>, <sense id="n22094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpunished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrestrained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">inultus): injuriam inultam impunitamque dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:58:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 58, § 149</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi vexatio direptioque sociorum impunita fuit ac libera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si istius haec tanta injuria impunita discesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:30:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 30, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Fulvio fugam ex proelio ipsius temeritatem commisso impunitam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 26, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furta omnia fuisse licita et impunita (al. impoenita),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 39, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 77</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tu impunitior illa obsonia captas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinem Appi Claudii, quo inpunitior sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impūnītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with impunity</hi>: alios in facinore gloriari, aliis ne dolere quidem impunite licere, Matius in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 59</bibl>: quo impunitius uxor ejus moecharetur, Fest. s. v. non omnibus, p. 173 a, Müll.</sense></entryFree>
impuratus: <entryFree id="n22095" type="main" key="impu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from impuro, not in use (for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 16</bibl>, the true reading is inspurcavit), <sense id="n22095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">morally defiled;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandoned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">impuratus me ille ut etiam irrideat?</quote> <trans><tr>that vile wretch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua, as a term of reproach,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi scio probiorem hanc esse quam te, impuratissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impuratissima illa capita (hominum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 221, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impure: <entryFree id="n22096" type="main" key="impu_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūrē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. impurus <sense id="n22096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
impurgabilis: <entryFree id="n22097" type="hapax" key="impurga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impurgābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpurgabilis</etym>, <sense id="n22097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be cleansed;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">inexcusable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
impuritas: <entryFree id="n22098" type="main" key="impu_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūrĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>impurus</etym>, <sense id="n22098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncleanness</hi> (in a moral sense), <hi rend="ital">pollution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impurity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes impuritates pudica in domo quotidie susciperes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
impuritia: <entryFree id="n22099" type="main" key="impu_ri^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūrĭtĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncleanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vileness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impurity</hi>, = impuritas (anteand post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): trecentis versibus Tuas impuritias transloqui nemo potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: deliquentium, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 6, 4, 3.</sense></entryFree>
impurus: <entryFree id="n22100" type="main" key="impu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impūrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inpurus</etym>, <sense id="n22100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unclean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi> (cf.: obscenus, spurcus, immundus). </sense><sense id="n22100.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">impurae matris prolapsus ab alvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:223" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 223</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22100.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unclean</hi> (in a moral sense), <hi rend="ital">impure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandoned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22100.3" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">impudens, impurus, inverecundissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his gregibus omnes aleatores, omnes adulteri, omnes impuri impudicique versantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persona illa lutulenta, impura, invisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o hominem impurum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: impuri cujusdam et ambitiosi sententia,<cb n="IMPU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum impuris atque immanibus adversariis decertare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(dux) audax, impurus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impurus et sceleratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat hic Corinthia anus haud impura,</quote> <trans><tr>tolerably decent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo haud impurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidine omni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 81</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis illo qui maledicit impurior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: omnium non bipedum solum, sed etiam quadrupedum impurissimus, Auct. Or. pro Dom. 18, 48.—</sense><sense id="n22100.4" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:108:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 108, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 66, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:416" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamina, i. e. venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid impurius, quam retinuisse talem (adulteram),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 80</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">impūrē</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">impurely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shamefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vilely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impure atque flagitiose vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa facere impure atque taetre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque intemperanter facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 21, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo impurissime haec nostra fortuna despecta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imputatio: <entryFree id="n22101" type="hapax" key="impu^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭtātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>imputo</etym>, <sense id="n22101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a charge</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut explorari possit, imputationes probe an improbe referantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:82" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 82 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
imputativus: <entryFree id="n22102" type="main" key="impu^ta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭtātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">charging;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">imputative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accusatory</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
imputator: <entryFree id="n22103" type="main" key="impu^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭtātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reckoner</hi> (post-Aug.); <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: beneficii,</quote> <trans><tr>one who reckons his benefits highly</tr>, <tr>thinks much of them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:17:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imputatus: <entryFree id="n22104" type="main" key="impu^ta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭtātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from imputo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22105" type="main" key="impu^ta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭtātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-putatus</etym>, <sense id="n22105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpruned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untrimmed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:44" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imputo: <entryFree id="n22106" type="main" key="impu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inputo</etym>, <sense id="n22106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring into the reckoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter into the account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi> (not ante-Aug.; cf. deputo). </sense><sense id="n22106.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilici servi longe plus imputant seminis jacti quam quod severint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus alicui ... viatica et vecturas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:52:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 52, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quartam hereditatis imputantur res, quas jure hereditario capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:90" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 35, 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in numerum trium tutelarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:61" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23, 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22106.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to enter into the account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attribute</hi> as a merit or a fault to one's self or another; <hi rend="ital">to make a boast of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to credit to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impute to</hi> (for the Ciceron. assignare, ascribere): fatum dies imputat, Sen. de Ira, 3, 42; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:20:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 20, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc non imputo in solutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudent muneribus, sed nec data imputant, nec acceptis obligantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli imputare vanum beneficium mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 22, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (Masinissae) imputari victum Hannibalem, huic captum Syphacem, huic Carthaginem deletam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii transeunt quaedam imputantque quod transeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum sibi eripere tot beneficiorum occasiones, tam numerosam obligandi imputandique materiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:39:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 39, 3</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quidam crimen ultro faterentur, nonnulli etiam imputarent,</quote> <trans><tr>made a merit of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl></cit>: saevit enim natumque objectat et imputat illis, <hi rend="ital">charges upon them</hi> (<hi rend="ital">his son</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s fate</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 400</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem senioribus imputat annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:470" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebellandi tempus Atheniensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:23:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ei caedes imputanda sit, a quo jurgium coepit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum exsilium rei publicae imputaturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospera omnes sibi vindicant, adversa uni imputantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui moras belli aut causas rebellandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam nostram illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tibi scilicet, qui requisisti, imputabis, si digna ne epistula quidem videbuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi imputent cur minus idoneum fidejussorem acceperint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:7:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imputet ipse deus nectar mihi, fiet acetum,</quote> <trans><tr>may assign</tr>, <tr>give</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:48:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 48, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otia parva nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:83:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 83, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc solum erit certamen, quis mihi plurimum imputet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imputresco: <entryFree id="n22107" type="hapax" key="impu^tresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">impŭtresco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>trui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n22107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [in-putresco], <hi rend="ital">to rot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrefy in</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">cum imputruit oleo mus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
imputribilis: <entryFree id="n22108" type="main" key="imputri^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">imputrĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-putresco</etym>, <sense id="n22108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not liable to decay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorruptible</hi> <cb n="IN" /> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Psa. 95" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Psa. 95</bibl>; id. Civ. Dei, 21, 7.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">imputrĭbĭ-lĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">incorruptibly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 32" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 32</bibl> ad Paul.</sense></entryFree>
imulus: <entryFree id="n22109" type="hapax" key="i^mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n22109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [imus], <hi rend="ital">the lowest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oricilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 2</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">auricula infima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
imus: <entryFree id="n22110" type="main" key="i^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. inferus.</entryFree>
in: <entryFree id="n22111" type="main" key="in1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in</orth> (old forms <orth extent="full" lang="la">endŏ</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">indŭ</orth>, freq. in ante-class. poets; cf. Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1096" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1096</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:102" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:890" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 890</bibl> et saep.), <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>abl.</case> and <case>acc.</case> [kindr. with Sanscr. an; Greek <foreign lang="greek">e)n, e)n-qa, e)n-qen, ei)s,</foreign> i. e. <foreign lang="greek">e)n-s, a)na/;</foreign> Goth. ana; Germ. in], denotes either rest or motion within or into a place or thing; opp. to ex; <sense id="n22111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at; into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22111.1" n="I" level="1"> With <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n22111.2" n="A" level="2"> In space. </sense><sense id="n22111.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> (with <case>abl.</case> of the place or thing in which): <cit><quote lang="la">aliorum fructus in terra est, aliorum et extra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 22, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii in corde, alii in cerebr?*! dixerunt animi esse sedem et locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo in rostris sedente suasit Serviliam legem Crassus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 43, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sunt cives in eadem re publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facillimam in ea re publica esse concordiam, in qua idem conducat omnibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Labienus ex loco superiore, quae res in nostris castris gererentur, conspicatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si in scaena, id est in contione verum valet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro palam Syracusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:33:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 33, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures in eo loco sine vulnere quam in proelio aut fuga intereunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tulit de caede, quae in Appia via facta esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in via fornicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigebat in illa domo mos patrius et disciplina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domo furtum factum ab eo qui domi fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nupta in domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias in castris continent,</quote> <trans><tr>in</tr>, <tr>within</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in angusto quodam pulpito stans diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:130" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ac suos in vehiculo conspici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo in illa tua sedecula sedere, quam in istorum sella curuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedere in solio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albae constiterant, in urbe opportuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Sometimes, also, with names of places: omnes se ultro sectari in Epheso memorat mulieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heri aliquot adolescentuli coïimus in Piraeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis et in Cajeta est parata nobis et Brundisii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complures (naves) in Hispali faciendas curavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesos in Marathone ac Salamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Berenice urbe Troglodytarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 183</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22111.4" n="2" level="3"> In indicating a multitude or number, of, in, or among which a person or thing is, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">among</hi> (= <hi rend="ital">gen. part.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">in his poëta hic nomen profitetur suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thales, qui sapientissimus in septem fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peto ut eum complectare, diligas, in tuis habeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:78:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 78, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in perditis et desperatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 56, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae secundum naturam fiunt, sunt habenda in bonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 19, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor in maximis malis ducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justissimus unus in Teucris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cecidere in pugna ad duo milia ... in his quatuor Romani centuriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diis et feminae sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 16, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22111.5" n="3" level="3"> Of analogous relations of place or position: <cit><quote lang="la">sedere in equo,</quote> <trans><tr>on horseback</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid legati in equis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pis. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedere in leone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo flumine pons erat,</quote> <trans><tr>on</tr>, <tr>over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in herboso Apidano,</quote> <trans><tr>on the banks of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in digitis,</quote> <trans><tr>on tiptoe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:267" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra in limite locat,</quote> <trans><tr>on the rampart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse coronam habebat unam in capite, alteram in collo,</quote> <trans><tr>on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleae in arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris in barbaris erat nomen obscurius,</quote> <trans><tr>among</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ceteris nationibus, Cels. praef. 1: qui in Brutiis praeerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in juvenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutus in mutis pro sermone est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 66</bibl></cit>.—Of dress, like <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, q. v.: <cit><quote lang="la">in veste candida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in calceis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in insignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tunicis albis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Persico et vulgari habitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lugubri veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tyriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Cois,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> v. 298; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines in catenis Romam mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 21, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 1, 8</bibl>: quis multa te in rosa urget, etc., Hor C. 1, 5, 1; so, in viola aut in rosa, Cic. Tusc. <pb n="912" /> <cb n="IN" /> 5, 26, 73.—So of arms: <cit><quote lang="la">duas legiones in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 395</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in armis hostis,</quote> <trans><tr>under arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12,65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in ore atque in oculis provinciae gesta sunt (= coram),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:33:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 33, § 81</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in oculis provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oculis omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae, decus, gloria in oculis sita sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Julianus in ore ejus (Vitellii) jugulatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:19:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 19, 7</bibl>.—Of a passage in any writing (but when the author is named, by meton., for his works, <hi rend="ital">apud</hi> is used, Krebs, Antibarb. p. 561): <cit><quote lang="la">in populorum institutis aut legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illis libris qui sunt de natura deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Timaeo dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula, in qua omnia perscripta erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perscribit in litteris, hostes ab se discessisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 49</bibl></cit>; but <hi rend="ital">in</hi> is also used with an author's name when, not a place in his book, but a feature of his style, etc., is referred to: <cit><quote lang="la">in Thucydide orbem modo orationis desidero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:234" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Herodoto omnia leniter fluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—Of books: <cit><quote lang="la">libri oratorii diu in manibus fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl>; but more freq. trop.: in manibus habere, tenere, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be engaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupied with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have under control</hi> or <hi rend="ital">within reach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi quamcunque rem habent in manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam spem nunc habeat in manibus, exponam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem habere in manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mihi in manu fuit Jugurtha qualis foret,</quote> <trans><tr>in my power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam nihil esse in manu sua respondebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ipsorum in manu sit, ... bellum an pacem malint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl></cit>; but, cum tantum belli in manibus esset, <hi rend="ital">was in hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busied</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter manus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 57, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quorum epistulas in manu teneo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in manu poculum tenens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronati et lauream in manu tenentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 37, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Of that which is thought of as existing in the mind, memory, character, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in animo esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animo habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex est ratio insita in natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in memoria sedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tacito mutos volvunt in pectore questus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta auctoritas fuit in C. Metello!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 17, 61</bibl></cit>. —So freq. of a person's qualities of mind or character: <cit><quote lang="la">erat in eo summa eloquentia, summa fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:28:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 28, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni animante est summum aliquid atque optimum, ut in equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:41:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 41, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid artis in medicis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nibil esse in morte timendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:866" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 866</bibl></cit>.— Esp., in eo loco, <hi rend="ital">in that state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo enim loco res sunt nostrae, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 35, 7</bibl></cit>: si vos in eo loco essetis, quid aliud fecissetis? Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 21</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quo in loco, etc.: cum ex equitum et calonum fuga, quo in loco res essent, cognovissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis, quo in loco res haec siet, Ter Phorm. 2, 4, 6: quod ipse, si in eodem loco esset, facturus fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, without loco, in eo esse ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be in such a condition</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non in eo esse Carthaginiensium res, ut Galliam armis obtineant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res non in eo esset, ut Cyprum tentaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 41, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Mil. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Mil. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Paus. 5, 1</bibl> (cf. I. C. 1. infra).—</sense><sense id="n22111.6" n="B" level="2"> In time, indicating its duration, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the course of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feci ego istaec itidem in adulescentia,</quote> <trans><tr>in my youth</tr>, <tr>when I was young</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tempore hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tali tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:28 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 28 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diebus paucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in brevi spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ea aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni aetate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aetate, qua jam Alexander orbem terrarum subegisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua (sc. Iphigenia) nihil erat in eo quidem anno natum pulchrius,</quote> <trans><tr>in the course of</tr>, <tr>during the year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 25, 95</bibl></cit> (al. eo quidem anno): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil in vita se simile fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 91</bibl></cit>: nihil in vita vidit calamitatis A. Cluentius. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tota vita inconstans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22111.7" n="b" level="4"> In tempore, <hi rend="ital">at the right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proper time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in time</hi> (Cic. uses only tempore; v. tempus): eccum ipsum video in tempore huc se recipere,<cb n="IN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni pedites equitesque in tempore subvenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spreta in tempore gloria interdum cumulatior redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebellaturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque adeo in ipso tempore eccum ipsum obviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: in tempore, opportune. Nos sine praepositione dicimus <hi rend="ital">tempore</hi> et <hi rend="ital">tempori</hi>, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22111.8" n="c" level="4"> In praesentia and in praesenti, <hi rend="ital">at present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at this moment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under these circumstances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim mihi in praesentia occurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrae quidem cenae non solum in praesentia, sed etiam postero die jucundae sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 35, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod unum maxime in praesentia desiderabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad te in praesenti scripsi, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>for the present</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22111.9" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gerunds</hi> and <hi rend="ital">fut. pass. participles</hi>, to indicate duration of time, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit, ut distrahatur in deliberando animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosum esse in dividendo partem in genere numerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in litteris dandis praeter consuetudinem proxima nocte vigilarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in quaerendis suis pugnandi tempus dimitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agris vastandis incendiisque faciendis hostibus,</quote> <trans><tr>in laying waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in excidenda Numantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in immolanda Iphigenia tristis Calchas esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 21, 74</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22111.10" n="C" level="2"> In other relations, where a person or thing is thought of as in a certain condition, situation, or relation, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui magno in aere alieno majores etiam possessiones habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in insperatis repentinisque pecuniis jactare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Larinum in summo timore omnium cum armatis advolavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 8, 25</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So freq., of qualities or states of mind: summa in sollicitudine ac timore Parthici belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpescentne dextrae in amentia illa?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc diem perpetuum in laetitia degere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in voluptate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui in amore esse,</quote> <trans><tr>beloved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui in amoribus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in invidia erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37, 17</bibl>: sum in expectatione omnium rerum, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num . . .
