Diogenem Stoicum coëgit in suis studiis obmutescere senectus?</quote> <trans><tr>in his studies</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirificam cepi voluptatem ex tua diligentia: quod in summis tuis occupationibus mihi tamen rei publicae statum per te notum esse voluisti,</quote> <trans><tr>even in</tr>, <tr>notwithstanding your great occupations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So freq., of business, employment, occupations, etc.: in aliqua re versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similia iis, quae in consilio dixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in certamine armorum atque in omni palaestra quid satis recte cavetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agi in judiciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum vos mihi essetis in consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 18, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in actione ... dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of an office, magistracy: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo tum magistratu forte Brutus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo magistratu pari diligentia se praebuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,023:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Han. 7, 5</bibl></cit> (cf. B. 1. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">in ea ipsa causa fuit eloquentissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut, 43, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non defendit nec obsistit, si potest, injuriae, tam est in vitio, quam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>is in the wrong</tr>, <tr>acts wrongly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi hoc quidem est in vitio, dissolutionem naturae tam valde perhorrescere,</quote> <trans><tr>is wrong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sunt in eo genere tantae commoditates corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">an omnino nulla sit in eo genere distinctio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:205" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 61, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Drusus erat de praevaricatione absolutus in summa quatuor sententiis,</quote> <trans><tr>on the whole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et in omni summa, ut mones, valde me ad otium pacemque converto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but, in summa, sic maxime judex credit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in a word</tr>, <tr>in fine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 72</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 71; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 37, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum (juvenum) inductio in parte simulacrum decurrentis exercitus erat: ex parte elegantioris exercitii quam militaris artis,</quote> <trans><tr>in part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi in parte verum videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patronorum in parte expeditior, in parte difficilior interrogatio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc facere in eo homine consueverunt,</quote> <trans><tr>in the case of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in furibus aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achilles talis in hoste fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc homine saepe a me quaeris, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in the case of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cb n="IN" /> in nominibus impiis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspectus et in morte matris fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui praesentes metuunt, in absentia hostes erunt, = absentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 8</bibl></cit> (cf. I. B. c. supra).—Of the meaning of words, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum in eodem sensu, sed etiam in diverso, eadem verba contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter voces aut eaedem in diversa significatione ponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sallustius in significatione ista non superesse sed superare dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stips non dicitur in significatione trunci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, 18, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper in significatione ea hortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 50</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22111.11" n="2" level="3"> In with <case>abl.</case> of <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> is used with the verbs <hi rend="ital">esse</hi> and <hi rend="ital">habere</hi> to express quality: <cit><quote lang="la">cum exitus haud in facili essent, i. e. haud faciles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo moderatio tuendae libertatis in difficili est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:11" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 65, 11</bibl>; but mostly with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> of the first and second declension: <cit><quote lang="la">in obscuro esse, Liv. praef. § 3: in dubio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 19, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum in dubiost animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in integro esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in incerto esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obvio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tuto esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">videre te in tuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aequo esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 37, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in expedito esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proximo esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aperto esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in promisco esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in augusto esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in incerto haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in levi habitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in incerto relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 83</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n22111.12" n="II" level="1"> With <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n22111.13" n="A" level="2"> In space, with verbs of motion, <hi rend="ital">into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a place or thing (rarely with names of towns and small islands; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Zumpt, Gram. § 398): influxit non tenuis quidam e Graecia rivulus in hanc urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Ephesum advenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Epirum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo in Piræeum, visamque, ecquae advenerit in portum ex Epheso navis mercatoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: venio ad Piræea, in quo magis reprehendendus sum, quod ... Piræea scripserim, non Piræeum, quam <hi rend="ital">in</hi> quod addiderim; <cit><quote lang="la">non enim hoc ut oppido praeposui, sed ut loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se contulisse Tarquinios, in urbem Etruriae florentissimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remigrare in domum veterem e nova,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in sua rura venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a te ipso missi in ultimas gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Ubios legatos mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dein Thalam pervenit, in oppidum magnum et opulentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Regillum antiquam in patriam se contulerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abire in exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 102</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">nuntio</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id Zmyrnam in contionem nuntiatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiatur in castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Most. Pers. 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">allatis in castra nuntiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: in manus sumere, tradere, etc., <hi rend="ital">into</hi> one's <hi rend="ital">hands</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste unumquodque vas in manus sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falerios se in manus Romanis tradidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with the verbs ponere, collocare, etc. (pregn., i. e. <hi rend="ital">to bring into</hi> ... and <hi rend="ital">place there</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">in crimen populo ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut liberos, uxores suaque omnia in silvas deponerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplam pecuniam in thesauros reponi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius me collocavi in arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sororem et propinquas suas nuptum in alias civitates collocasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.— Motion in any direction, <hi rend="ital">up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">down to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caelum ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium ipse paene in umeros suos extulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam in aram confugitis ad deum,</quote> <trans><tr>up to the altar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:10:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturno tenebrosa in Tartara misso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in flumen deicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chab. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chab. 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22111.14" n="2" level="3"> Denoting mere direction towards a place or thing, and hence sometimes joined with versus, <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc supina sursum in caelum conspicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in latus aut dextrum aut sinistrum, ut ipsi in usu est, cubat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Belgae spectant in septentriones et orientem solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in orientem Germaniae, in occidentem Hispaniae obtenditur, Gallis in meridiem etiam inspicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in laevum prona nixus sedet Inachus urna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:218" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 218</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">versus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra ex Biturigibus movet in Arvernos versus,</quote> <trans><tr>towards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Galliam versus movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 4</bibl></cit>: in <pb n="913" /> <cb n="IN" /> ltaliam versus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in urbem versus venturi erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 82</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22111.15" n="3" level="3"> So of that which is thought of as entering <hi rend="ital">into</hi> the mind, memory, etc. (cf. I. A. 2. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">in memoriam reducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 1, 52, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animum inducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mentem venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens imitatio transit in mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Or into a writing or speech: in illam Metellinam orationem addidi quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22111.16" n="B" level="2"> In time, <hi rend="ital">into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">till</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dormiet in lucem,</quote> <trans><tr>into the daylight</tr>, <tr>till broad day</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim e somno, quem plerumque in diem extrahunt, lavantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>: sermonem in multam noctem produximus, <hi rend="ital">deep into the night</hi>, Cic. Rep. Fragm. ap. Arus. Mess. p. 239 Lindem.: <cit><quote lang="la">in multam noctem luxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si febris in noctem augetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit in noctem atque etiam nocte illatis lucernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indutias in triginta annos impetraverunt,</quote> <trans><tr>for thirty years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 20, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi id verbum in omne tempus perdidissem,</quote> <trans><tr>forever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cenam hominem in hortos invitavit in posterum diem,</quote> <trans><tr>for the following day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audistis auctionem constitutam in mensem Januarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito reliquit annum suum seque in annum proximum transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis defectiones itemque lunae praedicuntur in multos annos,</quote> <trans><tr>for many years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die Romani ab sole orto in multum diei stetere in acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ab matutino tempore duraverunt in occasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 31, 31, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seritur (semen lini) a Kalendis Octobribus in ortum aquilae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 17</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">usque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illi didicerunt haec usque in senectutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illum usque diem servati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in serum usque patente cubiculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum trahat usque in tempora fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:392" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 392</bibl></cit>: in posterum (posteritatem) or in futurum, <hi rend="ital">in future</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the future</hi>: in praesens, <hi rend="ital">for the present</hi>: in perpetuum or in aeternum, <hi rend="ital">forever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sancit in posterum, ne quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res dilata est in posterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video quanta tempestas invidiae nobis, si minus in praesens, at in posteritatem impendeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id aegre et in praesentia hi passi et in futurum etiam metum ceperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 27, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti omnium et in praesens laetitia et in futurum spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effugis in futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eum tibi quaestoris in loco constitueras, idcirco tibi amicum in perpetuum fore putasti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum omni periculo in perpetuum liberavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (leges) non in tempus aliquod, sed perpetuae utilitatis causa in aeternum latae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: in tempus, <hi rend="ital">for a while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for a short time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the occasion</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sensit miles in tempus conficta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne urbs sine imperio esset, in tempus deligebatur, qui jus redderet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaena in tempus structa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 20</bibl></cit>. —So in diem, <hi rend="ital">for the day</hi>, to meet the day's want: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ex raptis in diem commeatibus superabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 40, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapto in diem frumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but, cum illa fundum emisset in diem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a fixed day of payment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: in singulos dies, or simply in dies, with comparatives and verbs denoting increase, <hi rend="ital">from day to day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium in dies crescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dies singulos breviores litteras ad te mitto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui senescat in dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 15</bibl></cit>: in diem, <hi rend="ital">daily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in diem vivimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diem et horam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 47</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in horas,</quote> <trans><tr>hourly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 13, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22111.17" n="C" level="2"> In other relations, in which an aiming at, an inclining or striving towards a thing, is conceivable, <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respecting; towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">against; for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as; in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to; into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, quod apud Platonem est in philosophos dictum,</quote> <trans><tr>about the philosophers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Callimachi epigramma in Ambraciotam Cleombrotum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cenaret Simonides apud Scopam cecinissetque id car men, quod in eum scripsisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo amore tandem inflammati esse debemus in ejus modi patriam,</quote> <trans><tr>towards</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in liberos nostros indulgentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 40, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de suis meritis in rem publicam aggressus est dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 38, 133</bibl></cit>: ita ad impietatem in deos, in <cb n="IN" /> homines adjunxit injuriam, <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dominum quaeri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be examined as a witness against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 22, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eos impetum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invehi in Thebanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tim. 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque est hominis definitio, una in omnes valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Leg. 1:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num etiam in deos immortales inauspicatam legem valuisse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor coram in os te laudare amplius,</quote> <trans><tr>to your face</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in me exerciturus (pugnos), quaeso, in parietem ut primum domes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in puppim rediere rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 545</bibl></cit> Burm. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic equi dicuntur in frena redire, pulsi in terga recedere, Sulp. ad loc.): Cumis eam vidi: venerat enim in funus: cui funeri ego quoque operam dedi,</quote> <trans><tr>to the funeral</tr>, <tr>to take charge of the funeral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl></cit>, B: <cit><quote lang="la">se quisque eum optabat, quem fortuna in id certamen legeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 42, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi in nullius mercedem negotia eant, pauciora fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec civitas mulieri redimiculum praebeat, haec in collum, haec in crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhegium quondam in praesidium missa legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">datae in praesidium cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 35</bibl></cit>: hoc idem significat Graecus ille in eam sententiam versus, <hi rend="ital">to this effect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purport</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 10, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec et in eam sententiam cum multa dixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnia sic exaequaverunt, ut in utramque partem ita paria redderent, uti nulla selectione uterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in utramque partem disputat,</quote> <trans><tr>on both sides</tr>, <tr>for and against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 23, 89</bibl></cit>: te rogo, me tibi in omnes partes defendendum putes, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facillime et in optimam partem cognoscuntur adulescentes, qui se ad claros et sapientes viros contulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives Romani servilem in modum cruciati et necati,</quote> <trans><tr>in the manner of slaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">miserandum in modum milites populi Romani capti, necati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senior quidam Veiens vaticinantis in modum cecinit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: domus et villae in urbium modum aedificatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde ac si in hanc formulam omnia judicia legitima sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium quin acciperet in ea ipsa verba quae Naevius edebat, non recusasse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 20, 63</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsultum in haec verba factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 43, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax data Philippo in has leges est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia omnis divisa est in partes tres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quidem in confirmationem et reprehensionem dividuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:9:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 9, 33</bibl></cit>: describebat censores binos in singulas civitates, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over each state</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque Titurium Tolosae quaternos denarios in singulas vini amphoras portorii nomine exegisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extulit eum plebs sextantibus collatis in capita,</quote> <trans><tr>a head</tr>, <tr>for each person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedonibus treceni nummi in capita statutum est pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracia in Rhoemetalcen filium ... inque liberos Cotyis dividitur (i. e. inter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22111.18" n="2" level="3"> Of the object or end in view, regarded also as the motive of action or effect: <cit><quote lang="la">non te in me illiberalem, sed me in se neglegentem putabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegentior in patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quem omnes intenderat curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ardere in proelia vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bellum ardentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutante in fugam exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hanc tam opimam mercedem agite ( = ut eam vobis paretis, Weissenb. ad loc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa praemia, in quorum spem pugnarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 45, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in id sors dejecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 42, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in id fide accepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spem pacis solutis animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 11, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrata misero vita ducenda est in hoc, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:63" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in hoc adhibetur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius non in hoc, ut offenderet, facit, id. de Ira, 2, 26, 3: in quod tum missi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—So, like <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, with words expressing affections or inclination of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">in obsequium plus aequo pronus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratus in res novas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in utrumque paratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22111.19" n="3" level="3"> Of the result of an act or effort: <cit><quote lang="la">denique in familiae luctum atque in privignorum funus nupsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratusque miles, ut ordo agminis in aciem adsisteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: excisum Euboicae latus ingens rupis in antrum,<cb n="IN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus ab Euroo fluctu curvatus in arcum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 533</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum in obsequia principum formavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium partium decus in mercedem conruptum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">commutari ex veris in falsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sollicitudinem versa fiducia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22111.20" n="4" level="3"> Esp. in the phrase: in gratiam or in honorem, alicujus, <hi rend="ital">in kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of good feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show honor</hi>, etc., to any one (first in Liv.; cf. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 21, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Antibarb. p. 562): in gratiam levium sociorum injuriam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 26, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnaturi in gratiam ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum in gratiam Saguntum deleverat Hannibal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 39, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio habita in sexus honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium in honorem victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in honorem Quadratillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in honorem tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 20:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 20, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:79:2" default="NO">79, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:92:1" default="NO">92, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n22111.21" n="5" level="3"> In the phrase, in rem esse, <hi rend="ital">to be useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to avail</hi> (cf.: e re esse; <cit><quote lang="la">opp.: contra rem esse): ut aequom est, quod in rem esse utrique arbitremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in rem est Bacchidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortatur, imperat, quae in rem sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, quae cognosse in rem erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rem fore credens universos adpellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in duas res magnas id usui fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hos usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 647</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22111.22" n="6" level="3"> To form adverbial expressions: <cit><quote lang="la">non nominatim, qui Capuae, sed in universum qui usquam coissent, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in general</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terra etsi aliquanto specie differt, in universum tamen aut silvis horrida aut paludibus foeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in universum aestimanti, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestate in totum, si fieri potest, abstinendum est (Venere),</quote> <trans><tr>wholly</tr>, <tr>entirely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in plenum dici potest, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>fully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marii virtutem in majus celebrare,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond due bounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter se corpus habere atque consuevit, neque in pejus tantum, sed etiam in melius,</quote> <trans><tr>for the worse</tr>, <tr>for the better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in deterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mollius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim est iracundia in supervacuum tumultuante frigidius? Sen. de Ira, 2, 11: civitas saepta muris neque in barbarum corrupta (v. barbarus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aucto in barbarum cognomento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam id sors cerneret, in incertum, ne quid gratia momenti faceret, in utramque provinciam decerni,</quote> <trans><tr>while the matter was uncertain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec puer Iliacā quisquam de gente Latinos In tantum spe tollet avos,</quote> <trans><tr>so much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:876" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 876</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantum suam felicitatem virtutemque enituisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 27, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam (aquae) fervent in tantum, ut non possint esse usui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri in tantum boni, in quantum humana simplicitas intellegi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:43:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 43, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe pedum digitos, in quantum quaeque secuta est, Traxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliore in omnia ingenio animoque quam fortuna usus,</quote> <trans><tr>in all respects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut simul in omnia paremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in antecessum dare,</quote> <trans><tr>beforehand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 118" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 118</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22111.23" n="7" level="3"> Sometimes with esse, habere, etc., <hi rend="ital">in</hi> is followed by the <case>acc.</case> (constr. pregn.), to indicate a direction, aim, purpose, etc. (but v. Madvig. Gram. § 230, obs. 2, note, who regards these accusatives as originating in errors of pronunciation); so, esse in potestatem alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to come into and remain in one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s power</hi>: esse in mentem alicui, <hi rend="ital">to come into and be in one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s mind</hi>: esse in conspectum, <hi rend="ital">to appear to and be in sight</hi>: esse in usum, <hi rend="ital">to come into use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be used</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod, qui illam partem urbis tenerent, in eorum potestatem portum futurum intellegebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut portus in potestatem Locrensium esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 14, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam optimam rem publicam esse duco, quae sit in potestatem optimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim sunt motus in nostram potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numero mihi in mentem fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid in mentem est tibi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prius surrexisse ac militibus in conspectum fuisse, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod satis in usum fuit, sublato, ceterum omne incensum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: ab hospitibus clientibusque suis, ab exteris nationibus, quae in amicitiam populi Romani dicionemque essent, injurias propulsare, Cic. Div. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:20:66" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 20, 66</bibl>: adesse in senatum <pb n="914" /> <cb n="INAC" /> jussit a. d. XIII. Kal. Octobr., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Phil. 5:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 19</bibl>.—Less freq. with habere: facito in memoriam habeas tuam majorem filiam mihi te despondisse, <hi rend="ital">call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring to mind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Minucium magistrum equitum, ne quid rei bellicae gereret, prope in custodiam habitum,</quote> <trans><tr>put in prison</tr>, <tr>kept in prison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos in custodiam habitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl></cit>.—So rarely with other verbs: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicetur se provinciam Galliam retenturum in senatus populique Romani potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22111.24" n="III" level="1"> In composition, <hi rend="ital">n</hi> regularly becomes assimilated to a foll. <hi rend="ital">l</hi>, <hi rend="ital">m</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">r</hi>, and is changed before the labials into <hi rend="ital">m</hi>: illabor, immitto, irrumpo, imbibo, impello.—As to its meaning, according as it is connected with a verb of rest or motion, it conveys the idea of existence <hi rend="ital">in</hi> a place or thing, or of motion, direction, or inclination <hi rend="ital">into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a place or thing: inesse; inhibere, inferre, impellere, etc. See Hand, Turs. III. pp. 243- 356.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22112" type="main" key="in2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in</orth> (before <sense id="n22112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">b</hi> and <hi rend="ital">p</hi>, im; before <hi rend="ital">l</hi>, <hi rend="ital">m</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">r</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">n</hi> assimilates itself to these consonants), an inseparable particle [kindred with Sanscr. a-, an-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)-, a)n;</foreign> Goth. and Germ. un-], which negatives the meaning of the noun or participle with which it is connected; Engl. <hi rend="ital">un-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not</hi>: impar, <hi rend="ital">unequal</hi>: intolerabilis, <hi rend="ital">unbearable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intolerable</hi>: immitis, <hi rend="ital">not mild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, etc.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22128" type="main" key="i^n3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-actŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inactive</hi> (post-class.): homo (with desidiosus), Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 16; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 587</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22141" type="main" key="i^n4"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aequābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uneven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unequal</hi> (rare, but good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">campester locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venarum inaequabili percussu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec inaequabili varietate distinguimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22141.1" n="II" level="1"> Of number, <hi rend="ital">disproportionate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 22</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaequābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unevenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unequally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturescunt ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 8</bibl></cit> Schneider: <cit><quote lang="la">rexit provinciam (with varie),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gessit censuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ina: <entryFree id="n22113" type="main" key="i_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thin fibre</hi> in paper (very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 31</bibl>: exiles et ilia a tenuitate inarum, quas Graeci in chartis ita appellant, videntur esse dicta, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. exiles, p. 81 Müll.; cf.: ilia dicta ab ina, quae pars chartae est tenuissima, id. s. v. ilia, p. 104 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
inabruptus: <entryFree id="n22114" type="hapax" key="i^nabruptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-abruptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not broken off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unbroken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">catena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:44" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inabscondibile: <entryFree id="n22115" type="gloss" key="i^nabscondi^bi^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-abscondĭbĭle</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)/krupton,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
inabsolutus: <entryFree id="n22116" type="main" key="i^nabso^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-absŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfinished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomplete</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 3, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaccedendus: <entryFree id="n22117" type="main" key="i^nacce_dendus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-accēdendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>accedo</etym>, <sense id="n22117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inaccessible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaccensus: <entryFree id="n22118" type="main" key="i^naccensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-accensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unkindled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not inflamed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:96" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus Veneri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaccessibilis: <entryFree id="n22119" type="main" key="i^naccessi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-accessĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unapproachable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inaccessible</hi> (post-class.): loca, Mam. Genethl. <bibl default="NO"><author>Maxim.</author> 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 11 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
inaccessus: <entryFree id="n22120" type="main" key="i^naccessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-accessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unapproached</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unapproachable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inaccessible</hi> (cf.: invius, impervius, devius, avius). </sense><sense id="n22120.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mare scopulis inaccessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 12, 16, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:14" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:516" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spelunca radiis solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 195</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22120.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unattainable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pindarus imitationi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formositas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 155</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaccresco: <entryFree id="n22121" type="hapax" key="i^naccresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-accresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nausea nominis inaccrescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inaccusabilis: <entryFree id="n22122" type="gloss" key="i^naccu_sa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-accūsābĭlis</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)ne/gklhtos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
inaccusatus: <entryFree id="n22123" type="main" key="i^naccu_sa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-accūsātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not accused</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inacerbo: <entryFree id="n22124" type="gloss" key="i^nacerbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-acerbo</orth> <foreign lang="greek">deinopoiw=,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
inacesco: <entryFree id="n22125" type="main" key="i^na^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ăcesco</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">inăcisco</orth>), <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăcŭi</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n22125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become sour in</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to turn sour</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22125.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 36, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus frequenter inacescit cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 104" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 104</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22125.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: haec tibi per totos inacescant omnia sensus, <hi rend="ital">let them sour.</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">imbitter you</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. A. 307</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi inacuit nostra contumelia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 163, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inachia: <entryFree id="n22126" type="main" key="I_na^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īnăchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 14</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
inachus: <entryFree id="n22127" type="main" key="I_na^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īnăchus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/inaxos,</foreign> <sense id="n22127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first king of Argos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Io and Phoroneus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 372</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 20</bibl>. Also, <hi rend="ital">a river in Argolis</hi> named for king Inachus, now <hi rend="ital">Banitza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 583</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">642</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 792</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:119" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 119</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22127.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n22127.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īnăchĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Inachian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also, i. q. <hi rend="ital">Argive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenca,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Io</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 153</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also: bos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Isis</tr>, <tr>identified with Io</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:658" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 658</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Juno against Io</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 139</bibl></cit>: Argi (<hi rend="ital">governed by Inachus</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">on the river Inachus</hi>),<cb n="INAE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 286</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the river Inachus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:397" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 397</bibl></cit>; but also <hi rend="ital">of the Lernean Sea</hi> (of Lerna, near Argos), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 634</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Adrastus</tr>, <tr>king of Argos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:145" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 145</bibl></cit>: litus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Argolic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:656" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 656</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:148" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Linus (as the son of the Argive Psamathe),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit> (3, 4), 8: <cit><quote lang="la">Perseus (as the son of the Argive Danaë),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 278</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22127.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īnă-chus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Grecian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:363" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 363</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22127.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īnăchĭ-des</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Inachus;</hi> so <hi rend="ital">Perseus</hi> (cf. in the preced.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 720</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">Epaphus</hi> (as the son of Io), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:753" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 753</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the Argives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:365" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 365</bibl>. — <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īnăchis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Inachian;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female descendant of Inachus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the river Inachus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acrisione (as the daughter of the Argive Danaë),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 11, 33</bibl></cit>.— <pos>Subst.</pos>, of <hi rend="ital">lo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33</bibl> (3, 31), 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:454" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 454</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 611</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">identified with Isis (v. above, under Inachius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:687" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 687</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īnăchĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">female Argives</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 407</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inactus: <entryFree id="n22129" type="main" key="i^nactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inigo.</entryFree>
inadc: <entryFree id="n22130" type="main" key="inadc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inadc-</orth>, v. inacc-.</entryFree>
inadf: <entryFree id="n22131" type="main" key="inadf"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inadf-</orth>, v. inaff-.</entryFree>
inadibilis: <entryFree id="n22132" type="hapax" key="i^na^di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnădĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-, 1. adeo</etym>, <sense id="n22132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unapproachable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inaccessible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus vestigio inspectoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 11, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inadp: <entryFree id="n22133" type="main" key="inadp"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inadp-</orth>, v. inapp-.</entryFree>
inads: <entryFree id="n22134" type="main" key="inads"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inads-</orth>, v. inass-.</entryFree>
inadsc: <entryFree id="n22135" type="main" key="inadsc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inadsc-</orth>, v. inasc</entryFree>
inadt: <entryFree id="n22136" type="main" key="inadt"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inadt-</orth>, v. inatt-.</entryFree>
inadulabilis: <entryFree id="n22137" type="hapax" key="i^na^du_la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ădūlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inaccessible to flattery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex (with incorruptus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inadustus: <entryFree id="n22138" type="main" key="i^na^dustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ădustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not burned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unburned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsinged</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaedificatio: <entryFree id="n22139" type="main" key="i^naedi^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaedĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, false reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 55</bibl>, for aedificatio.</entryFree>
inaedifico: <entryFree id="n22140" type="main" key="i^naedi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aedĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to build in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">at</hi> a place; <hi rend="ital">to build up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22140.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">neiquis in ieis loceis ... quid inaedificatum inmolitumve habeto, Lex. Jul. Munic. 71: inaedificata in muris moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de domo tua, in qua ita est inaedificatum sacellum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 14, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjectis celeriter stramentis (tecta) inaedificare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 8:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in loca publica inaedificata habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus primis et quinto aquilarum generi inaedificatur nido lapis aëtites,</quote> <trans><tr>is built into</tr>, <tr>made a part of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra pilas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. aedificare).— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi inaedificata superne multa forent multis nubila,</quote> <trans><tr>piled upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 264</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22140.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22140.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To build up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wall up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas obstruit, vicos plateasque inaedificat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec clausae modo portae, sed etiam inaedificatae erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a Serrano sanctissima sacella suffossa, inaedificata, oppressa ... foedata esse nescimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 15, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22140.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To build upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cover with buildings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 43 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n22140.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to burden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum imponere et, ut ita dicam, inaedificare voluisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaequabilitas: <entryFree id="n22142" type="main" key="i^naequa_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaequābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inaequabilis</etym>, <sense id="n22142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inequality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlikeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variety</hi> (postclass. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:3:108" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, 3, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22142.1" n="II" level="1"> Gramm. t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">a)nwmali/a,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">want of uniformity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anomaly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
